      <title>The Third Part of Henry the Sixth</title>

      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>The Third Part of Henry the Sixth</h1>
         </header>
         <div class="lists-of-titles">
            <div class="toc">
               <p>
                  <b>Table of Contents</b>
               </p>
               <ul class="toc">

                           </span>

                           </span>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.9">8. SCENE VIII.  London. The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>

                           </span>

            </div>
         </div>
         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">KING HENRY, the Sixth.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">EDWARD, PRINCE OF WALES, his son. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">KING LEWIS XI, King of France. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DUKE OF SOMERSET</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DUKE OF EXETER</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">EARL OF OXFORD</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">EARL OF NORTHUMBERLAND</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">EARL OF WESTMORELAND</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LORD CLIFFORD</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">RICHARD PLANTAGENET, Duke of York. </span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">EDWARD, Earl of March, afterwards King Edward IV.</span>
                        <span class="personname">EDMUND, Earl of Rutland.</span>
                        <span class="personname">GEORGE, afterwards Duke of</span>
                        <span class="personname">Clarence. </span>
                        <span class="personname">RICHARD afterwards Duke of</span>
                        <span class="personname">Gloucester.</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">his sons.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DUKE OF NORFOLK</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">MARQUESS OF MONTAGUE</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">EARL OF WARWICK</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">EARL OF PEMBROKE</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LORD HASTINGS</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LORD STAFFORD</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">SIR JOHN MORTIMER</span>
                        <span class="personname">SIR HUGH MORTIMER</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">uncles to the Duke of York.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">HENRY, Earl of Richmond, a youth.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LORD RIVERS, brother to Lady Grey. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR WILLIAM STANLEY</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR JOHN MONTGOMERY</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR JOHN SOMERVILLE</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Tutor to Rutland. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Mayor of York. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Lieutenant of the Tower. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Nobleman. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Two Keepers.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Huntsman. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Son that has killed his father. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Father that has killed his son. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">QUEEN MARGARET</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LADY GREY, afterwards Queen to Edward IV. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">BONA, sister to the French Queen.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Soldiers, Attendants, Messengers, Watchmen, &c.</span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  England and France.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  London. The Parliament-house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  Sandal Castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.5">4. SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  London. The Parliament-house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum. Enter YORK, EDWARD, RICHARD, NORFOLK, MONTAGUE, WARWICK, and Soldiers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">I wonder how the king escaped our hands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">While we pursued the horsemen of the north,</div>
                     <div class="line">He slily stole away and left his men:</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereat the great Lord of Northumberland,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose warlike ears could never brook retreat,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cheer'd up the drooping army; and himself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Clifford and Lord Stafford, all abreast,</div>
                     <div class="line">Charged our main battle's front, and breaking in</div>
                     <div class="line">Were by the swords of common soldiers slain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Stafford's father, Duke of Buckingham,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is either slain or wounded dangerously;</div>
                     <div class="line">I cleft his beaver with a downright blow:</div>
                     <div class="line">That this is true, father, behold his blood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                     <div class="line">And, brother, here's the Earl of Wiltshire's blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom I encounter'd as the battles join'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak thou for me and tell them what I did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Throwing down SOMERSET's head</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Richard hath best deserved of all my sons.</div>
                     <div class="line">But is your grace dead, my Lord of Somerset?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Such hope have all the line of John of Gaunt!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus do I hope to shake King Henry's head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">And so do I. Victorious Prince of York,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before I see thee seated in that throne</div>
                     <div class="line">Which now the house of Lancaster usurps,</div>
                     <div class="line">I vow by heaven these eyes shall never close.</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the palace of the fearful king,</div>
                     <div class="line">And this the regal seat: possess it, York;</div>
                     <div class="line">For this is thine and not King Henry's heirs'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Assist me, then, sweet Warwick, and I will;</div>
                     <div class="line">For hither we have broken in by force.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll all assist you; he that flies shall die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Thanks, gentle Norfolk: stay by me, my lords;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, soldiers, stay and lodge by me this night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>They go up</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">And when the king comes, offer no violence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless he seek to thrust you out perforce.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">The queen this day here holds her parliament,</div>
                     <div class="line">But little thinks we shall be of her council:</div>
                     <div class="line">By words or blows here let us win our right.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Arm'd as we are, let's stay within this house.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">The bloody parliament shall this be call'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless Plantagenet, Duke of York, be king,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bashful Henry deposed, whose cowardice</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath made us by-words to our enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Then leave me not, my lords; be resolute;</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean to take possession of my right.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Neither the king, nor he that loves him best,</div>
                     <div class="line">The proudest he that holds up Lancaster,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dares stir a wing, if Warwick shake his bells.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll plant Plantagenet, root him up who dares:</div>
                     <div class="line">Resolve thee, Richard; claim the English crown.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish. Enter KING HENRY VI, CLIFFORD,
NORTHUMBERLAND, WESTMORELAND, EXETER, and the rest</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">My lords, look where the sturdy rebel sits,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in the chair of state: belike he means,</div>
                     <div class="line">Back'd by the power of Warwick, that false peer,</div>
                     <div class="line">To aspire unto the crown and reign as king.</div>
                     <div class="line">Earl of Northumberland, he slew thy father.</div>
                     <div class="line">And thine, Lord Clifford; and you both have vow'd revenge</div>
                     <div class="line">On him, his sons, his favourites and his friends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">If I be not, heavens be revenged on me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">The hope thereof makes Clifford mourn in steel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">What, shall we suffer this? let's pluck him down:</div>
                     <div class="line">My heart for anger burns; I cannot brook it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Be patient, gentle Earl of Westmoreland.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Patience is for poltroons, such as he:</div>
                     <div class="line">He durst not sit there, had your father lived.</div>
                     <div class="line">My gracious lord, here in the parliament</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us assail the family of York.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Well hast thou spoken, cousin: be it so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, know you not the city favours them,</div>
                     <div class="line">And they have troops of soldiers at their beck?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">But when the duke is slain, they'll quickly fly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Far be the thought of this from Henry's heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make a shambles of the parliament-house!</div>
                     <div class="line">Cousin of Exeter, frowns, words and threats</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be the war that Henry means to use.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou factious Duke of York, descend my throne,</div>
                     <div class="line">and kneel for grace and mercy at my feet;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am thy sovereign.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">I am thine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">For shame, come down: he made thee Duke of York.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas my inheritance, as the earldom was.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy father was a traitor to the crown.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Exeter, thou art a traitor to the crown</div>
                     <div class="line">In following this usurping Henry.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom should he follow but his natural king?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">True, Clifford; and that's Richard Duke of York.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">And shall I stand, and thou sit in my throne?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">It must and shall be so: content thyself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Be Duke of Lancaster; let him be king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">He is both king and Duke of Lancaster;</div>
                     <div class="line">And that the Lord of Westmoreland shall maintain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">And Warwick shall disprove it. You forget</div>
                     <div class="line">That we are those which chased you from the field</div>
                     <div class="line">And slew your fathers, and with colours spread</div>
                     <div class="line">March'd through the city to the palace gates.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, Warwick, I remember it to my grief;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, by his soul, thou and thy house shall rue it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Plantagenet, of thee and these thy sons,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy kinsman and thy friends, I'll have more lives</div>
                     <div class="line">Than drops of blood were in my father's veins.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Urge it no more; lest that, instead of words,</div>
                     <div class="line">I send thee, Warwick, such a messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">As shall revenge his death before I stir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor Clifford! how I scorn his worthless threats!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you we show our title to the crown?</div>
                     <div class="line">If not, our swords shall plead it in the field.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">What title hast thou, traitor, to the crown?</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy father was, as thou art, Duke of York;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy grandfather, Roger Mortimer, Earl of March:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am the son of Henry the Fifth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who made the Dauphin and the French to stoop</div>
                     <div class="line">And seized upon their towns and provinces.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Talk not of France, sith thou hast lost it all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">The lord protector lost it, and not I:</div>
                     <div class="line">When I was crown'd I was but nine months old.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">You are old enough now, and yet, methinks, you lose.</div>
                     <div class="line">Father, tear the crown from the usurper's head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet father, do so; set it on your head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                     <div class="line">Good brother, as thou lovest and honourest arms,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's fight it out and not stand cavilling thus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Sound drums and trumpets, and the king will fly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Sons, peace!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, thou! and give King Henry leave to speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Plantagenet shall speak first: hear him, lords;</div>
                     <div class="line">And be you silent and attentive too,</div>
                     <div class="line">For he that interrupts him shall not live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Think'st thou that I will leave my kingly throne,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein my grandsire and my father sat?</div>
                     <div class="line">No: first shall war unpeople this my realm;</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and their colours, often borne in France,</div>
                     <div class="line">And now in England to our heart's great sorrow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be my winding-sheet. Why faint you, lords?</div>
                     <div class="line">My title's good, and better far than his.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Prove it, Henry, and thou shalt be king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Henry the Fourth by conquest got the crown.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas by rebellion against his king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  I know not what to say; my title's weak.--</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me, may not a king adopt an heir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">What then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">An if he may, then am I lawful king;</div>
                     <div class="line">For Richard, in the view of many lords,</div>
                     <div class="line">Resign'd the crown to Henry the Fourth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose heir my father was, and I am his.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">He rose against him, being his sovereign,</div>
                     <div class="line">And made him to resign his crown perforce.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Suppose, my lords, he did it unconstrain'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Think you 'twere prejudicial to his crown?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">No; for he could not so resign his crown</div>
                     <div class="line">But that the next heir should succeed and reign.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou against us, Duke of Exeter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">His is the right, and therefore pardon me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Why whisper you, my lords, and answer not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">My conscience tells me he is lawful king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  All will revolt from me, and turn to him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Plantagenet, for all the claim thou lay'st,</div>
                     <div class="line">Think not that Henry shall be so deposed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Deposed he shall be, in despite of all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art deceived: 'tis not thy southern power,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Essex, Norfolk, Suffolk, nor of Kent,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which makes thee thus presumptuous and proud,</div>
                     <div class="line">Can set the duke up in despite of me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">King Henry, be thy title right or wrong,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Clifford vows to fight in thy defence:</div>
                     <div class="line">May that ground gape and swallow me alive,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where I shall kneel to him that slew my father!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">O Clifford, how thy words revive my heart!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Henry of Lancaster, resign thy crown.</div>
                     <div class="line">What mutter you, or what conspire you, lords?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Do right unto this princely Duke of York,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or I will fill the house with armed men,</div>
                     <div class="line">And over the chair of state, where now he sits,</div>
                     <div class="line">Write up his title with usurping blood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>He stamps with his foot and the soldiers show
themselves</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">My Lord of Warwick, hear me but one word:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me for this my life-time reign as king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Confirm the crown to me and to mine heirs,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou shalt reign in quiet while thou livest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">I am content: Richard Plantagenet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Enjoy the kingdom after my decease.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">What wrong is this unto the prince your son!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">What good is this to England and himself!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Base, fearful and despairing Henry!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">How hast thou injured both thyself and us!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot stay to hear these articles.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, cousin, let us tell the queen these news.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, faint-hearted and degenerate king,</div>
                     <div class="line">In whose cold blood no spark of honour bides.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Be thou a prey unto the house of York,</div>
                     <div class="line">And die in bands for this unmanly deed!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">In dreadful war mayst thou be overcome,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or live in peace abandon'd and despised!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt NORTHUMBERLAND, CLIFFORD, and WESTMORELAND</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Turn this way, Henry, and regard them not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">They seek revenge and therefore will not yield.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, Exeter!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Why should you sigh, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Not for myself, Lord Warwick, but my son,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom I unnaturally shall disinherit.</div>
                     <div class="line">But be it as it may: I here entail</div>
                     <div class="line">The crown to thee and to thine heirs for ever;</div>
                     <div class="line">Conditionally, that here thou take an oath</div>
                     <div class="line">To cease this civil war, and, whilst I live,</div>
                     <div class="line">To honour me as thy king and sovereign,</div>
                     <div class="line">And neither by treason nor hostility</div>
                     <div class="line">To seek to put me down and reign thyself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">This oath I willingly take and will perform.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Long live King Henry! Plantagenet embrace him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">And long live thou and these thy forward sons!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Now York and Lancaster are reconciled.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">Accursed be he that seeks to make them foes!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Sennet. Here they come down</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, my gracious lord; I'll to my castle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll keep London with my soldiers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">And I to Norfolk with my followers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                     <div class="line">And I unto the sea from whence I came.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt YORK, EDWARD, EDMUND, GEORGE, RICHARD,
WARWICK, NORFOLK, MONTAGUE, their Soldiers, and
Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">And I, with grief and sorrow, to the court.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter QUEEN MARGARET and PRINCE EDWARD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes the queen, whose looks bewray her anger:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll steal away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Exeter, so will I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, go not from me; I will follow thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Be patient, gentle queen, and I will stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Who can be patient in such extremes?</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, wretched man! would I had died a maid</div>
                     <div class="line">And never seen thee, never borne thee son,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seeing thou hast proved so unnatural a father</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath he deserved to lose his birthright thus?</div>
                     <div class="line">Hadst thou but loved him half so well as I,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or felt that pain which I did for him once,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or nourish'd him as I did with my blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wouldst have left thy dearest heart-blood there,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rather than have that savage duke thine heir</div>
                     <div class="line">And disinherited thine only son.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Father, you cannot disinherit me:</div>
                     <div class="line">If you be king, why should not I succeed?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon me, Margaret; pardon me, sweet son:</div>
                     <div class="line">The Earl of Warwick and the duke enforced me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Enforced thee! art thou king, and wilt be forced?</div>
                     <div class="line">I shame to hear thee speak. Ah, timorous wretch!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast undone thyself, thy son and me;</div>
                     <div class="line">And given unto the house of York such head</div>
                     <div class="line">As thou shalt reign but by their sufferance.</div>
                     <div class="line">To entail him and his heirs unto the crown,</div>
                     <div class="line">What is it, but to make thy sepulchre</div>
                     <div class="line">And creep into it far before thy time?</div>
                     <div class="line">Warwick is chancellor and the lord of Calais;</div>
                     <div class="line">Stern Falconbridge commands the narrow seas;</div>
                     <div class="line">The duke is made protector of the realm;</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet shalt thou be safe? such safety finds</div>
                     <div class="line">The trembling lamb environed with wolves.</div>
                     <div class="line">Had I been there, which am a silly woman,</div>
                     <div class="line">The soldiers should have toss'd me on their pikes</div>
                     <div class="line">Before I would have granted to that act.</div>
                     <div class="line">But thou preferr'st thy life before thine honour:</div>
                     <div class="line">And seeing thou dost, I here divorce myself</div>
                     <div class="line">Both from thy table, Henry, and thy bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Until that act of parliament be repeal'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereby my son is disinherited.</div>
                     <div class="line">The northern lords that have forsworn thy colours</div>
                     <div class="line">Will follow mine, if once they see them spread;</div>
                     <div class="line">And spread they shall be, to thy foul disgrace</div>
                     <div class="line">And utter ruin of the house of York.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus do I leave thee. Come, son, let's away;</div>
                     <div class="line">Our army is ready; come, we'll after them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, gentle Margaret, and hear me speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast spoke too much already: get thee gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentle son Edward, thou wilt stay with me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, to be murder'd by his enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">When I return with victory from the field</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll see your grace: till then I'll follow her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, son, away; we may not linger thus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt QUEEN MARGARET and PRINCE EDWARD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor queen! how love to me and to her son</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath made her break out into terms of rage!</div>
                     <div class="line">Revenged may she be on that hateful duke,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose haughty spirit, winged with desire,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will cost my crown, and like an empty eagle</div>
                     <div class="line">Tire on the flesh of me and of my son!</div>
                     <div class="line">The loss of those three lords torments my heart:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll write unto them and entreat them fair.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, cousin you shall be the messenger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">And I, I hope, shall reconcile them all.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt</p>
                     <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Sandal Castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter RICHARD, EDWARD, and MONTAGUE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Brother, though I be youngest, give me leave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I can better play the orator.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                     <div class="line">But I have reasons strong and forcible.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter YORK</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, how now, sons and brother! at a strife?</div>
                     <div class="line">What is your quarrel? how began it first?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">No quarrel, but a slight contention.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">About what?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">About that which concerns your grace and us;</div>
                     <div class="line">The crown of England, father, which is yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine boy? not till King Henry be dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Your right depends not on his life or death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Now you are heir, therefore enjoy it now:</div>
                     <div class="line">By giving the house of Lancaster leave to breathe,</div>
                     <div class="line">It will outrun you, father, in the end.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">I took an oath that he should quietly reign.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">But for a kingdom any oath may be broken:</div>
                     <div class="line">I would break a thousand oaths to reign one year.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">No; God forbid your grace should be forsworn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall be, if I claim by open war.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll prove the contrary, if you'll hear me speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou canst not, son; it is impossible.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">An oath is of no moment, being not took</div>
                     <div class="line">Before a true and lawful magistrate,</div>
                     <div class="line">That hath authority over him that swears:</div>
                     <div class="line">Henry had none, but did usurp the place;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, seeing 'twas he that made you to depose,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your oath, my lord, is vain and frivolous.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, to arms! And, father, do but think</div>
                     <div class="line">How sweet a thing it is to wear a crown;</div>
                     <div class="line">Within whose circuit is Elysium</div>
                     <div class="line">And all that poets feign of bliss and joy.</div>
                     <div class="line">Why do we finger thus? I cannot rest</div>
                     <div class="line">Until the white rose that I wear be dyed</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in the lukewarm blood of Henry's heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Richard, enough; I will be king, or die.</div>
                     <div class="line">Brother, thou shalt to London presently,</div>
                     <div class="line">And whet on Warwick to this enterprise.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou, Richard, shalt to the Duke of Norfolk,</div>
                     <div class="line">And tell him privily of our intent.</div>
                     <div class="line">You Edward, shall unto my Lord Cobham,</div>
                     <div class="line">With whom the Kentishmen will willingly rise:</div>
                     <div class="line">In them I trust; for they are soldiers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Witty, courteous, liberal, full of spirit.</div>
                     <div class="line">While you are thus employ'd, what resteth more,</div>
                     <div class="line">But that I seek occasion how to rise,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet the king not privy to my drift,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor any of the house of Lancaster?</div>
                     <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                     <div class="line">But, stay: what news? Why comest thou in such post?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">The queen with all the northern earls and lords</div>
                     <div class="line">Intend here to besiege you in your castle:</div>
                     <div class="line">She is hard by with twenty thousand men;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore fortify your hold, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, with my sword. What! think'st thou that we fear them?</div>
                     <div class="line">Edward and Richard, you shall stay with me;</div>
                     <div class="line">My brother Montague shall post to London:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let noble Warwick, Cobham, and the rest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom we have left protectors of the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">With powerful policy strengthen themselves,</div>
                     <div class="line">And trust not simple Henry nor his oaths.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                     <div class="line">Brother, I go; I'll win them, fear it not:</div>
                     <div class="line">And thus most humbly I do take my leave.</div>
                     <p>Exit</p>
                     <p>Enter JOHN MORTIMER and HUGH MORTIMER</p>
                     <div class="line">Sir John and Sir Hugh Mortimer, mine uncles,</div>
                     <div class="line">You are come to Sandal in a happy hour;</div>
                     <div class="line">The army of the queen mean to besiege us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOHN MORTIMER</div>
                     <div class="line">She shall not need; we'll meet her in the field.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">What, with five thousand men?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, with five hundred, father, for a need:</div>
                     <div class="line">A woman's general; what should we fear?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>A march afar off</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I hear their drums: let's set our men in order,</div>
                     <div class="line">And issue forth and bid them battle straight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Five men to twenty! though the odds be great,</div>
                     <div class="line">I doubt not, uncle, of our victory.</div>
                     <div class="line">Many a battle have I won in France,</div>
                     <div class="line">When as the enemy hath been ten to one:</div>
                     <div class="line">Why should I not now have the like success?</div>
                     <p>Alarum. Exeunt</p>
                     <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarums. Enter RUTLAND and his Tutor</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RUTLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, whither shall I fly to 'scape their hands?</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, tutor, look where bloody Clifford comes!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CLIFFORD and Soldiers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Chaplain, away! thy priesthood saves thy life.</div>
                     <div class="line">As for the brat of this accursed duke,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose father slew my father, he shall die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Tutor</div>
                     <div class="line">And I, my lord, will bear him company.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Soldiers, away with him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Tutor</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, Clifford, murder not this innocent child,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest thou be hated both of God and man!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit, dragged off by Soldiers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">How now! is he dead already? or is it fear</div>
                     <div class="line">That makes him close his eyes? I'll open them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RUTLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">So looks the pent-up lion o'er the wretch</div>
                     <div class="line">That trembles under his devouring paws;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so he walks, insulting o'er his prey,</div>
                     <div class="line">And so he comes, to rend his limbs asunder.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, gentle Clifford, kill me with thy sword,</div>
                     <div class="line">And not with such a cruel threatening look.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet Clifford, hear me speak before I die.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am too mean a subject for thy wrath:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be thou revenged on men, and let me live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">In vain thou speak'st, poor boy; my father's blood</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath stopp'd the passage where thy words should enter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RUTLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let my father's blood open it again:</div>
                     <div class="line">He is a man, and, Clifford, cope with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Had thy brethren here, their lives and thine</div>
                     <div class="line">Were not revenge sufficient for me;</div>
                     <div class="line">No, if I digg'd up thy forefathers' graves</div>
                     <div class="line">And hung their rotten coffins up in chains,</div>
                     <div class="line">It could not slake mine ire, nor ease my heart.</div>
                     <div class="line">The sight of any of the house of York</div>
                     <div class="line">Is as a fury to torment my soul;</div>
                     <div class="line">And till I root out their accursed line</div>
                     <div class="line">And leave not one alive, I live in hell.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Lifting his hand</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RUTLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">O, let me pray before I take my death!</div>
                     <div class="line">To thee I pray; sweet Clifford, pity me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Such pity as my rapier's point affords.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RUTLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">I never did thee harm: why wilt thou slay me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy father hath.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RUTLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">But 'twas ere I was born.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast one son; for his sake pity me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest in revenge thereof, sith God is just,</div>
                     <div class="line">He be as miserably slain as I.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, let me live in prison all my days;</div>
                     <div class="line">And when I give occasion of offence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let me die, for now thou hast no cause.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">No cause!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy father slew my father; therefore, die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Stabs him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RUTLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Di faciant laudis summa sit ista tuae!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Dies</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Plantagenet! I come, Plantagenet!</div>
                     <div class="line">And this thy son's blood cleaving to my blade</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall rust upon my weapon, till thy blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Congeal'd with this, do make me wipe off both.</div>
                     <p>Exit</p>
                     <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum. Enter YORK</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">The army of the queen hath got the field:</div>
                     <div class="line">My uncles both are slain in rescuing me;</div>
                     <div class="line">And all my followers to the eager foe</div>
                     <div class="line">Turn back and fly, like ships before the wind</div>
                     <div class="line">Or lambs pursued by hunger-starved wolves.</div>
                     <div class="line">My sons, God knows what hath bechanced them:</div>
                     <div class="line">But this I know, they have demean'd themselves</div>
                     <div class="line">Like men born to renown by life or death.</div>
                     <div class="line">Three times did Richard make a lane to me.</div>
                     <div class="line">And thrice cried 'Courage, father! fight it out!'</div>
                     <div class="line">And full as oft came Edward to my side,</div>
                     <div class="line">With purple falchion, painted to the hilt</div>
                     <div class="line">In blood of those that had encounter'd him:</div>
                     <div class="line">And when the hardiest warriors did retire,</div>
                     <div class="line">Richard cried 'Charge! and give no foot of ground!'</div>
                     <div class="line">And cried 'A crown, or else a glorious tomb!</div>
                     <div class="line">A sceptre, or an earthly sepulchre!'</div>
                     <div class="line">With this, we charged again: but, out, alas!</div>
                     <div class="line">We bodged again; as I have seen a swan</div>
                     <div class="line">With bootless labour swim against the tide</div>
                     <div class="line">And spend her strength with over-matching waves.</div>
                     <p>A short alarum within</p>
                     <div class="line">Ah, hark! the fatal followers do pursue;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I am faint and cannot fly their fury:</div>
                     <div class="line">And were I strong, I would not shun their fury:</div>
                     <div class="line">The sands are number'd that make up my life;</div>
                     <div class="line">Here must I stay, and here my life must end.</div>
                     <p>Enter QUEEN MARGARET, CLIFFORD, NORTHUMBERLAND,
PRINCE EDWARD, and Soldiers</p>
                     <div class="line">Come, bloody Clifford, rough Northumberland,</div>
                     <div class="line">I dare your quenchless fury to more rage:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am your butt, and I abide your shot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Yield to our mercy, proud Plantagenet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, to such mercy as his ruthless arm,</div>
                     <div class="line">With downright payment, show'd unto my father.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now Phaethon hath tumbled from his car,</div>
                     <div class="line">And made an evening at the noontide prick.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">My ashes, as the phoenix, may bring forth</div>
                     <div class="line">A bird that will revenge upon you all:</div>
                     <div class="line">And in that hope I throw mine eyes to heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">Scorning whate'er you can afflict me with.</div>
                     <div class="line">Why come you not? what! multitudes, and fear?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">So cowards fight when they can fly no further;</div>
                     <div class="line">So doves do peck the falcon's piercing talons;</div>
