                     <div class="line">Would I were dead! if God's good will were so;</div>
                     <div class="line">For what is in this world but grief and woe?</div>
                     <div class="line">O God! methinks it were a happy life,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be no better than a homely swain;</div>
                     <div class="line">To sit upon a hill, as I do now,</div>
                     <div class="line">To carve out dials quaintly, point by point,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thereby to see the minutes how they run,</div>
                     <div class="line">How many make the hour full complete;</div>
                     <div class="line">How many hours bring about the day;</div>
                     <div class="line">How many days will finish up the year;</div>
                     <div class="line">How many years a mortal man may live.</div>
                     <div class="line">When this is known, then to divide the times:</div>
                     <div class="line">So many hours must I tend my flock;</div>
                     <div class="line">So many hours must I take my rest;</div>
                     <div class="line">So many hours must I contemplate;</div>
                     <div class="line">So many hours must I sport myself;</div>
                     <div class="line">So many days my ewes have been with young;</div>
                     <div class="line">So many weeks ere the poor fools will ean:</div>
                     <div class="line">So many years ere I shall shear the fleece:</div>
                     <div class="line">So minutes, hours, days, months, and years,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pass'd over to the end they were created,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would bring white hairs unto a quiet grave.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, what a life were this! how sweet! how lovely!</div>
                     <div class="line">Gives not the hawthorn-bush a sweeter shade</div>
                     <div class="line">To shepherds looking on their silly sheep,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than doth a rich embroider'd canopy</div>
                     <div class="line">To kings that fear their subjects' treachery?</div>
                     <div class="line">O, yes, it doth; a thousand-fold it doth.</div>
                     <div class="line">And to conclude, the shepherd's homely curds,</div>
                     <div class="line">His cold thin drink out of his leather bottle.</div>
                     <div class="line">His wonted sleep under a fresh tree's shade,</div>
                     <div class="line">All which secure and sweetly he enjoys,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is far beyond a prince's delicates,</div>
                     <div class="line">His viands sparkling in a golden cup,</div>
                     <div class="line">His body couched in a curious bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">When care, mistrust, and treason waits on him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum. Enter a Son that has killed his father,
dragging in the dead body</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Son</div>
                     <div class="line">Ill blows the wind that profits nobody.</div>
                     <div class="line">This man, whom hand to hand I slew in fight,</div>
                     <div class="line">May be possessed with some store of crowns;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I, that haply take them from him now,</div>
                     <div class="line">May yet ere night yield both my life and them</div>
                     <div class="line">To some man else, as this dead man doth me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Who's this? O God! it is my father's face,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom in this conflict I unwares have kill'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">O heavy times, begetting such events!</div>
                     <div class="line">From London by the king was I press'd forth;</div>
                     <div class="line">My father, being the Earl of Warwick's man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Came on the part of York, press'd by his master;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I, who at his hands received my life, him</div>
                     <div class="line">Have by my hands of life bereaved him.</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon me, God, I knew not what I did!</div>
                     <div class="line">And pardon, father, for I knew not thee!</div>
                     <div class="line">My tears shall wipe away these bloody marks;</div>
                     <div class="line">And no more words till they have flow'd their fill.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">O piteous spectacle! O bloody times!</div>
                     <div class="line">Whiles lions war and battle for their dens,</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor harmless lambs abide their enmity.</div>
                     <div class="line">Weep, wretched man, I'll aid thee tear for tear;</div>
                     <div class="line">And let our hearts and eyes, like civil war,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be blind with tears, and break o'ercharged with grief.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Father that has killed his son, bringing in the body</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Father</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou that so stoutly hast resisted me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me thy gold, if thou hast any gold:</div>
                     <div class="line">For I have bought it with an hundred blows.</div>
                     <div class="line">But let me see: is this our foeman's face?</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, no, no, no, it is mine only son!</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, boy, if any life be left in thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Throw up thine eye! see, see what showers arise,</div>
                     <div class="line">Blown with the windy tempest of my heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon thy words, that kill mine eye and heart!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, pity, God, this miserable age!</div>
                     <div class="line">What stratagems, how fell, how butcherly,</div>
                     <div class="line">Erroneous, mutinous and unnatural,</div>
                     <div class="line">This deadly quarrel daily doth beget!</div>
                     <div class="line">O boy, thy father gave thee life too soon,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hath bereft thee of thy life too late!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Woe above woe! grief more than common grief!</div>
                     <div class="line">O that my death would stay these ruthful deeds!</div>
                     <div class="line">O pity, pity, gentle heaven, pity!</div>
                     <div class="line">The red rose and the white are on his face,</div>
                     <div class="line">The fatal colours of our striving houses:</div>
                     <div class="line">The one his purple blood right well resembles;</div>
                     <div class="line">The other his pale cheeks, methinks, presenteth:</div>
                     <div class="line">Wither one rose, and let the other flourish;</div>
                     <div class="line">If you contend, a thousand lives must wither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Son</div>
                     <div class="line">How will my mother for a father's death</div>
                     <div class="line">Take on with me and ne'er be satisfied!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Father</div>
                     <div class="line">How will my wife for slaughter of my son</div>
                     <div class="line">Shed seas of tears and ne'er be satisfied!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">How will the country for these woful chances</div>
                     <div class="line">Misthink the king and not be satisfied!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Son</div>
                     <div class="line">Was ever son so rued a father's death?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Father</div>
                     <div class="line">Was ever father so bemoan'd his son?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Was ever king so grieved for subjects' woe?</div>
                     <div class="line">Much is your sorrow; mine ten times so much.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Son</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll bear thee hence, where I may weep my fill.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit with the body</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Father</div>
                     <div class="line">These arms of mine shall be thy winding-sheet;</div>
                     <div class="line">My heart, sweet boy, shall be thy sepulchre,</div>
                     <div class="line">For from my heart thine image ne'er shall go;</div>
                     <div class="line">My sighing breast shall be thy funeral bell;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so obsequious will thy father be,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even for the loss of thee, having no more,</div>
                     <div class="line">As Priam was for all his valiant sons.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll bear thee hence; and let them fight that will,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I have murdered where I should not kill.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit with the body</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Sad-hearted men, much overgone with care,</div>
                     <div class="line">Here sits a king more woful than you are.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Alarums: excursions. Enter QUEEN MARGARET, PRINCE
EDWARD, and EXETER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Fly, father, fly! for all your friends are fled,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Warwick rages like a chafed bull:</div>
                     <div class="line">Away! for death doth hold us in pursuit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Mount you, my lord; towards Berwick post amain:</div>
                     <div class="line">Edward and Richard, like a brace of greyhounds</div>
                     <div class="line">Having the fearful flying hare in sight,</div>
                     <div class="line">With fiery eyes sparkling for very wrath,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bloody steel grasp'd in their ireful hands,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are at our backs; and therefore hence amain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">Away! for vengeance comes along with them:</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, stay not to expostulate, make speed;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else come after: I'll away before.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, take me with thee, good sweet Exeter:</div>
                     <div class="line">Not that I fear to stay, but love to go</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither the queen intends. Forward; away!</div>
                     <p>Exeunt</p>
                     <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>A loud alarum. Enter CLIFFORD, wounded</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Here burns my candle out; ay, here it dies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, whiles it lasted, gave King Henry light.</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lancaster, I fear thy overthrow</div>
                     <div class="line">More than my body's parting with my soul!</div>
                     <div class="line">My love and fear glued many friends to thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, now I fall, thy tough commixture melts.</div>
                     <div class="line">Impairing Henry, strengthening misproud York,</div>
                     <div class="line">The common people swarm like summer flies;</div>
                     <div class="line">And whither fly the gnats but to the sun?</div>
                     <div class="line">And who shines now but Henry's enemies?</div>
                     <div class="line">O Phoebus, hadst thou never given consent</div>
                     <div class="line">That Phaethon should cheque thy fiery steeds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy burning car never had scorch'd the earth!</div>
                     <div class="line">And, Henry, hadst thou sway'd as kings should do,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or as thy father and his father did,</div>
                     <div class="line">Giving no ground unto the house of York,</div>
                     <div class="line">They never then had sprung like summer flies;</div>
                     <div class="line">I and ten thousand in this luckless realm</div>
                     <div class="line">Had left no mourning widows for our death;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou this day hadst kept thy chair in peace.</div>
                     <div class="line">For what doth cherish weeds but gentle air?</div>
                     <div class="line">And what makes robbers bold but too much lenity?</div>
                     <div class="line">Bootless are plaints, and cureless are my wounds;</div>
                     <div class="line">No way to fly, nor strength to hold out flight:</div>
                     <div class="line">The foe is merciless, and will not pity;</div>
                     <div class="line">For at their hands I have deserved no pity.</div>
                     <div class="line">The air hath got into my deadly wounds,</div>
                     <div class="line">And much effuse of blood doth make me faint.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, York and Richard, Warwick and the rest;</div>
                     <div class="line">I stabb'd your fathers' bosoms, split my breast.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>He faints</p>
               <p>Alarum and retreat. Enter EDWARD, GEORGE, RICHARD,
MONTAGUE, WARWICK, and Soldiers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Now breathe we, lords: good fortune bids us pause,</div>
                     <div class="line">And smooth the frowns of war with peaceful looks.</div>
                     <div class="line">Some troops pursue the bloody-minded queen,</div>
                     <div class="line">That led calm Henry, though he were a king,</div>
                     <div class="line">As doth a sail, fill'd with a fretting gust,</div>
                     <div class="line">Command an argosy to stem the waves.</div>
                     <div class="line">But think you, lords, that Clifford fled with them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">No, 'tis impossible he should escape,</div>
                     <div class="line">For, though before his face I speak the words</div>
                     <div class="line">Your brother Richard mark'd him for the grave:</div>
                     <div class="line">And wheresoe'er he is, he's surely dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>CLIFFORD groans, and dies</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose soul is that which takes her heavy leave?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">A deadly groan, like life and death's departing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">See who it is: and, now the battle's ended,</div>
                     <div class="line">If friend or foe, let him be gently used.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Revoke that doom of mercy, for 'tis Clifford;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who not contented that he lopp'd the branch</div>
                     <div class="line">In hewing Rutland when his leaves put forth,</div>
                     <div class="line">But set his murdering knife unto the root</div>
                     <div class="line">From whence that tender spray did sweetly spring,</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean our princely father, Duke of York.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">From off the gates of York fetch down the head,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your father's head, which Clifford placed there;</div>
                     <div class="line">Instead whereof let this supply the room:</div>
                     <div class="line">Measure for measure must be answered.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring forth that fatal screech-owl to our house,</div>
                     <div class="line">That nothing sung but death to us and ours:</div>
                     <div class="line">Now death shall stop his dismal threatening sound,</div>
                     <div class="line">And his ill-boding tongue no more shall speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">I think his understanding is bereft.</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, Clifford, dost thou know who speaks to thee?</div>
                     <div class="line">Dark cloudy death o'ershades his beams of life,</div>
                     <div class="line">And he nor sees nor hears us what we say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">O, would he did! and so perhaps he doth:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis but his policy to counterfeit,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because he would avoid such bitter taunts</div>
                     <div class="line">Which in the time of death he gave our father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GEORGE</div>
                     <div class="line">If so thou think'st, vex him with eager words.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Clifford, ask mercy and obtain no grace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Clifford, repent in bootless penitence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Clifford, devise excuses for thy faults.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GEORGE</div>
                     <div class="line">While we devise fell tortures for thy faults.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou didst love York, and I am son to York.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou pitied'st Rutland; I will pity thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GEORGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Where's Captain Margaret, to fence you now?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">They mock thee, Clifford: swear as thou wast wont.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">What, not an oath? nay, then the world goes hard</div>
                     <div class="line">When Clifford cannot spare his friends an oath.</div>
                     <div class="line">I know by that he's dead; and, by my soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">If this right hand would buy two hour's life,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I in all despite might rail at him,</div>
                     <div class="line">This hand should chop it off, and with the</div>
                     <div class="line">issuing blood</div>
                     <div class="line">Stifle the villain whose unstanched thirst</div>
                     <div class="line">York and young Rutland could not satisfy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but he's dead: off with the traitor's head,</div>
                     <div class="line">And rear it in the place your father's stands.</div>
                     <div class="line">And now to London with triumphant march,</div>
                     <div class="line">There to be crowned England's royal king:</div>
                     <div class="line">From whence shall Warwick cut the sea to France,</div>
                     <div class="line">And ask the Lady Bona for thy queen:</div>
                     <div class="line">So shalt thou sinew both these lands together;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, having France thy friend, thou shalt not dread</div>
                     <div class="line">The scatter'd foe that hopes to rise again;</div>
                     <div class="line">For though they cannot greatly sting to hurt,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet look to have them buzz to offend thine ears.</div>
                     <div class="line">First will I see the coronation;</div>
                     <div class="line">And then to Brittany I'll cross the sea,</div>
                     <div class="line">To effect this marriage, so it please my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Even as thou wilt, sweet Warwick, let it be;</div>
                     <div class="line">For in thy shoulder do I build my seat,</div>
                     <div class="line">And never will I undertake the thing</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein thy counsel and consent is wanting.</div>
                     <div class="line">Richard, I will create thee Duke of Gloucester,</div>
                     <div class="line">And George, of Clarence: Warwick, as ourself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall do and undo as him pleaseth best.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me be Duke of Clarence, George of Gloucester;</div>
                     <div class="line">For Gloucester's dukedom is too ominous.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Tut, that's a foolish observation:</div>
                     <div class="line">Richard, be Duke of Gloucester. Now to London,</div>
                     <div class="line">To see these honours in possession.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt</p>
                     <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.5">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 3. ACT III</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  London. The palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.4">3. SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter two Keepers, with cross-bows in their hands</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">Under this thick-grown brake we'll shroud ourselves;</div>
                     <div class="line">For through this laund anon the deer will come;</div>
                     <div class="line">And in this covert will we make our stand,</div>
                     <div class="line">Culling the principal of all the deer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll stay above the hill, so both may shoot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">That cannot be; the noise of thy cross-bow</div>
                     <div class="line">Will scare the herd, and so my shoot is lost.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here stand we both, and aim we at the best:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, for the time shall not seem tedious,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tell thee what befell me on a day</div>
                     <div class="line">In this self-place where now we mean to stand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes a man; let's stay till he be past.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING HENRY VI, disguised, with a prayerbook</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">From Scotland am I stol'n, even of pure love,</div>
                     <div class="line">To greet mine own land with my wishful sight.</div>
                     <div class="line">No, Harry, Harry, 'tis no land of thine;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy place is fill'd, thy sceptre wrung from thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy balm wash'd off wherewith thou wast anointed:</div>
                     <div class="line">No bending knee will call thee Caesar now,</div>
                     <div class="line">No humble suitors press to speak for right,</div>
                     <div class="line">No, not a man comes for redress of thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">For how can I help them, and not myself?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, here's a deer whose skin's a keeper's fee:</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the quondam king; let's seize upon him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me embrace thee, sour adversity,</div>
                     <div class="line">For wise men say it is the wisest course.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">Why linger we? let us lay hands upon him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">Forbear awhile; we'll hear a little more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">My queen and son are gone to France for aid;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, as I hear, the great commanding Warwick</div>
                     <div class="line">Is thither gone, to crave the French king's sister</div>
                     <div class="line">To wife for Edward: if this news be true,</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor queen and son, your labour is but lost;</div>
                     <div class="line">For Warwick is a subtle orator,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Lewis a prince soon won with moving words.</div>
                     <div class="line">By this account then Margaret may win him;</div>
                     <div class="line">For she's a woman to be pitied much:</div>
                     <div class="line">Her sighs will make a battery in his breast;</div>
                     <div class="line">Her tears will pierce into a marble heart;</div>
                     <div class="line">The tiger will be mild whiles she doth mourn;</div>
                     <div class="line">And Nero will be tainted with remorse,</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear and see her plaints, her brinish tears.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but she's come to beg, Warwick to give;</div>
                     <div class="line">She, on his left side, craving aid for Henry,</div>
                     <div class="line">He, on his right, asking a wife for Edward.</div>
                     <div class="line">She weeps, and says her Henry is deposed;</div>
                     <div class="line">He smiles, and says his Edward is install'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">That she, poor wretch, for grief can speak no more;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whiles Warwick tells his title, smooths the wrong,</div>
                     <div class="line">Inferreth arguments of mighty strength,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in conclusion wins the king from her,</div>
                     <div class="line">With promise of his sister, and what else,</div>
                     <div class="line">To strengthen and support King Edward's place.</div>
                     <div class="line">O Margaret, thus 'twill be; and thou, poor soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">Art then forsaken, as thou went'st forlorn!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, what art thou that talk'st of kings and queens?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">More than I seem, and less than I was born to:</div>
                     <div class="line">A man at least, for less I should not be;</div>
                     <div class="line">And men may talk of kings, and why not I?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but thou talk'st as if thou wert a king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, so I am, in mind; and that's enough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">But, if thou be a king, where is thy crown?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">My crown is in my heart, not on my head;</div>
                     <div class="line">Not decked with diamonds and Indian stones,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor to be seen: my crown is called content:</div>
                     <div class="line">A crown it is that seldom kings enjoy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, if you be a king crown'd with content,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your crown content and you must be contented</div>
                     <div class="line">To go along with us; for as we think,</div>
                     <div class="line">You are the king King Edward hath deposed;</div>
                     <div class="line">And we his subjects sworn in all allegiance</div>
                     <div class="line">Will apprehend you as his enemy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">But did you never swear, and break an oath?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">No, never such an oath; nor will not now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Where did you dwell when I was King of England?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">Here in this country, where we now remain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">I was anointed king at nine months old;</div>
                     <div class="line">My father and my grandfather were kings,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you were sworn true subjects unto me:</div>
                     <div class="line">And tell me, then, have you not broke your oaths?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">No;</div>
                     <div class="line">For we were subjects but while you were king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, am I dead? do I not breathe a man?</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, simple men, you know not what you swear!</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, as I blow this feather from my face,</div>
                     <div class="line">And as the air blows it to me again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Obeying with my wind when I do blow,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yielding to another when it blows,</div>
                     <div class="line">Commanded always by the greater gust;</div>
                     <div class="line">Such is the lightness of you common men.</div>
                     <div class="line">But do not break your oaths; for of that sin</div>
                     <div class="line">My mild entreaty shall not make you guilty.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go where you will, the king shall be commanded;</div>
                     <div class="line">And be you kings, command, and I'll obey.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">We are true subjects to the king, King Edward.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">So would you be again to Henry,</div>
                     <div class="line">If he were seated as King Edward is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Keeper</div>
                     <div class="line">We charge you, in God's name, and the king's,</div>
                     <div class="line">To go with us unto the officers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">In God's name, lead; your king's name be obey'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">And what God will, that let your king perform;</div>
                     <div class="line">And what he will, I humbly yield unto.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt</p>
                     <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  London. The palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING EDWARD IV, GLOUCESTER, CLARENCE, and
LADY GREY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Brother of Gloucester, at Saint Alban's field</div>
                     <div class="line">This lady's husband, Sir Richard Grey, was slain,</div>
                     <div class="line">His lands then seized on by the conqueror:</div>
                     <div class="line">Her suit is now to repossess those lands;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which we in justice cannot well deny,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because in quarrel of the house of York</div>
                     <div class="line">The worthy gentleman did lose his life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Your highness shall do well to grant her suit;</div>
                     <div class="line">It were dishonour to deny it her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">It were no less; but yet I'll make a pause.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to CLARENCE</span>  Yea, is it so?</div>
                     <div class="line">I see the lady hath a thing to grant,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before the king will grant her humble suit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to GLOUCESTER</span>  He knows the game: how true</div>
                     <div class="line">he keeps the wind!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to CLARENCE</span>  Silence!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Widow, we will consider of your suit;</div>
                     <div class="line">And come some other time to know our mind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Right gracious lord, I cannot brook delay:</div>
                     <div class="line">May it please your highness to resolve me now;</div>
                     <div class="line">And what your pleasure is, shall satisfy me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to CLARENCE</span>  Ay, widow? then I'll warrant</div>
                     <div class="line">you all your lands,</div>
                     <div class="line">An if what pleases him shall pleasure you.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fight closer, or, good faith, you'll catch a blow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to GLOUCESTER</span>  I fear her not, unless she</div>
                     <div class="line">chance to fall.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to CLARENCE</span> God forbid that! for he'll</div>
                     <div class="line">take vantages.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">How many children hast thou, widow? tell me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to GLOUCESTER</span>  I think he means to beg a</div>
                     <div class="line">child of her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to CLARENCE</span>  Nay, whip me then: he'll rather</div>
                     <div class="line">give her two.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Three, my most gracious lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to CLARENCE</span>  You shall have four, if you'll</div>
                     <div class="line">be ruled by him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twere pity they should lose their father's lands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Be pitiful, dread lord, and grant it then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Lords, give us leave: I'll try this widow's wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to CLARENCE</span>  Ay, good leave have you; for</div>
                     <div class="line">you will have leave,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till youth take leave and leave you to the crutch.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>GLOUCESTER and CLARENCE retire</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Now tell me, madam, do you love your children?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, full as dearly as I love myself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">And would you not do much to do them good?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">To do them good, I would sustain some harm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Then get your husband's lands, to do them good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore I came unto your majesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tell you how these lands are to be got.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">So shall you bind me to your highness' service.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">What service wilt thou do me, if I give them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">What you command, that rests in me to do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">But you will take exceptions to my boon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">No, gracious lord, except I cannot do it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but thou canst do what I mean to ask.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then I will do what your grace commands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to CLARENCE</span>  He plies her hard; and much rain</div>
                     <div class="line">wears the marble.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to GLOUCESTER</span>  As red as fire! nay, then</div>
                     <div class="line">her wax must melt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Why stops my lord, shall I not hear my task?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">An easy task; 'tis but to love a king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">That's soon perform'd, because I am a subject.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then, thy husband's lands I freely give thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">I take my leave with many thousand thanks.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to CLARENCE</span>  The match is made; she seals it</div>
                     <div class="line">with a curtsy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">But stay thee, 'tis the fruits of love I mean.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">The fruits of love I mean, my loving liege.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but, I fear me, in another sense.</div>
                     <div class="line">What love, think'st thou, I sue so much to get?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">My love till death, my humble thanks, my prayers;</div>
                     <div class="line">That love which virtue begs and virtue grants.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">No, by my troth, I did not mean such love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then you mean not as I thought you did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">But now you partly may perceive my mind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">My mind will never grant what I perceive</div>
                     <div class="line">Your highness aims at, if I aim aright.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">To tell thee plain, I aim to lie with thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">To tell you plain, I had rather lie in prison.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then thou shalt not have thy husband's lands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then mine honesty shall be my dower;</div>
                     <div class="line">For by that loss I will not purchase them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Therein thou wrong'st thy children mightily.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Herein your highness wrongs both them and me.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, mighty lord, this merry inclination</div>
                     <div class="line">Accords not with the sadness of my suit:</div>
                     <div class="line">Please you dismiss me either with 'ay' or 'no.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, if thou wilt say 'ay' to my request;</div>
                     <div class="line">No if thou dost say 'no' to my demand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, no, my lord. My suit is at an end.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to CLARENCE</span>  The widow likes him not, she</div>
                     <div class="line">knits her brows.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to GLOUCESTER</span>  He is the bluntest wooer in</div>
                     <div class="line">Christendom.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Her looks do argue her replete with modesty;</div>
                     <div class="line">Her words do show her wit incomparable;</div>
                     <div class="line">All her perfections challenge sovereignty:</div>
                     <div class="line">One way or other, she is for a king;</div>
                     <div class="line">And she shall be my love, or else my queen.--</div>
                     <div class="line">Say that King Edward take thee for his queen?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis better said than done, my gracious lord:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am a subject fit to jest withal,</div>
                     <div class="line">But far unfit to be a sovereign.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet widow, by my state I swear to thee</div>
                     <div class="line">I speak no more than what my soul intends;</div>
                     <div class="line">And that is, to enjoy thee for my love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">And that is more than I will yield unto:</div>
                     <div class="line">I know I am too mean to be your queen,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet too good to be your concubine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">You cavil, widow: I did mean, my queen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twill grieve your grace my sons should call you father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">No more than when my daughters call thee mother.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art a widow, and thou hast some children;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, by God's mother, I, being but a bachelor,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have other some: why, 'tis a happy thing</div>
                     <div class="line">To be the father unto many sons.</div>
                     <div class="line">Answer no more, for thou shalt be my queen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to CLARENCE</span>  The ghostly father now hath done</div>
                     <div class="line">his shrift.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to GLOUCESTER</span>  When he was made a shriver,</div>
                     <div class="line">'twas for shift.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Brothers, you muse what chat we two have had.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">The widow likes it not, for she looks very sad.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll think it strange if I should marry her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, Clarence, to myself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">That would be ten days' wonder at the least.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">That's a day longer than a wonder lasts.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">By so much is the wonder in extremes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, jest on, brothers: I can tell you both</div>
                     <div class="line">Her suit is granted for her husband's lands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Nobleman</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nobleman</div>
                     <div class="line">My gracious lord, Henry your foe is taken,</div>
                     <div class="line">And brought your prisoner to your palace gate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                     <div class="line">See that he be convey'd unto the Tower:</div>
                     <div class="line">And go we, brothers, to the man that took him,</div>
                     <div class="line">To question of his apprehension.</div>
                     <div class="line">Widow, go you along. Lords, use her honourably.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but GLOUCESTER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, Edward will use women honourably.</div>
                     <div class="line">Would he were wasted, marrow, bones and all,</div>
                     <div class="line">That from his loins no hopeful branch may spring,</div>
                     <div class="line">To cross me from the golden time I look for!</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet, between my soul's desire and me--</div>
                     <div class="line">The lustful Edward's title buried--</div>
                     <div class="line">Is Clarence, Henry, and his son young Edward,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all the unlook'd for issue of their bodies,</div>
                     <div class="line">To take their rooms, ere I can place myself:</div>
                     <div class="line">A cold premeditation for my purpose!</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then, I do but dream on sovereignty;</div>
                     <div class="line">Like one that stands upon a promontory,</div>
                     <div class="line">And spies a far-off shore where he would tread,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wishing his foot were equal with his eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">And chides the sea that sunders him from thence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Saying, he'll lade it dry to have his way:</div>
                     <div class="line">So do I wish the crown, being so far off;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so I chide the means that keeps me from it;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so I say, I'll cut the causes off,</div>
                     <div class="line">Flattering me with impossibilities.</div>
                     <div class="line">My eye's too quick, my heart o'erweens too much,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless my hand and strength could equal them.</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, say there is no kingdom then for Richard;</div>
                     <div class="line">What other pleasure can the world afford?</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll make my heaven in a lady's lap,</div>
                     <div class="line">And deck my body in gay ornaments,</div>
                     <div class="line">And witch sweet ladies with my words and looks.</div>
                     <div class="line">O miserable thought! and more unlikely</div>
                     <div class="line">Than to accomplish twenty golden crowns!</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, love forswore me in my mother's womb:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, for I should not deal in her soft laws,</div>
                     <div class="line">She did corrupt frail nature with some bribe,</div>
                     <div class="line">To shrink mine arm up like a wither'd shrub;</div>
                     <div class="line">To make an envious mountain on my back,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where sits deformity to mock my body;</div>
                     <div class="line">To shape my legs of an unequal size;</div>
                     <div class="line">To disproportion me in every part,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like to a chaos, or an unlick'd bear-whelp</div>
                     <div class="line">That carries no impression like the dam.</div>
                     <div class="line">And am I then a man to be beloved?</div>
                     <div class="line">O monstrous fault, to harbour such a thought!</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, since this earth affords no joy to me,</div>
                     <div class="line">But to command, to cheque, to o'erbear such</div>
                     <div class="line">As are of better person than myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll make my heaven to dream upon the crown,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, whiles I live, to account this world but hell,</div>
                     <div class="line">Until my mis-shaped trunk that bears this head</div>
                     <div class="line">Be round impaled with a glorious crown.</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet I know not how to get the crown,</div>
                     <div class="line">For many lives stand between me and home:</div>
                     <div class="line">And I,--like one lost in a thorny wood,</div>
                     <div class="line">That rends the thorns and is rent with the thorns,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seeking a way and straying from the way;</div>
                     <div class="line">Not knowing how to find the open air,</div>
                     <div class="line">But toiling desperately to find it out,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Torment myself to catch the English crown:</div>
                     <div class="line">And from that torment I will free myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or hew my way out with a bloody axe.</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, I can smile, and murder whiles I smile,</div>
                     <div class="line">And cry 'Content' to that which grieves my heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">And wet my cheeks with artificial tears,</div>
                     <div class="line">And frame my face to all occasions.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll drown more sailors than the mermaid shall;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll slay more gazers than the basilisk;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll play the orator as well as Nestor,</div>
                     <div class="line">Deceive more slily than Ulysses could,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, like a Sinon, take another Troy.</div>
                     <div class="line">I can add colours to the chameleon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Change shapes with Proteus for advantages,</div>
                     <div class="line">And set the murderous Machiavel to school.</div>
                     <div class="line">Can I do this, and cannot get a crown?</div>
                     <div class="line">Tut, were it farther off, I'll pluck it down.</div>
                     <p>Exit</p>
                     <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish. Enter KING LEWIS XI, his sister BONA,
his Admiral, called BOURBON, PRINCE EDWARD, QUEEN
MARGARET, and OXFORD. KING LEWIS XI sits, and
riseth up again</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
