                              <div class="line">My conscience tells me he is lawful king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  All will revolt from me, and turn to him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Plantagenet, for all the claim thou lay'st,</div>
                              <div class="line">Think not that Henry shall be so deposed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Deposed he shall be, in despite of all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art deceived: 'tis not thy southern power,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of Essex, Norfolk, Suffolk, nor of Kent,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which makes thee thus presumptuous and proud,</div>
                              <div class="line">Can set the duke up in despite of me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">King Henry, be thy title right or wrong,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord Clifford vows to fight in thy defence:</div>
                              <div class="line">May that ground gape and swallow me alive,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where I shall kneel to him that slew my father!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">O Clifford, how thy words revive my heart!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Henry of Lancaster, resign thy crown.</div>
                              <div class="line">What mutter you, or what conspire you, lords?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Do right unto this princely Duke of York,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or I will fill the house with armed men,</div>
                              <div class="line">And over the chair of state, where now he sits,</div>
                              <div class="line">Write up his title with usurping blood.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>He stamps with his foot and the soldiers show
themselves</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of Warwick, hear me but one word:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me for this my life-time reign as king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Confirm the crown to me and to mine heirs,</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou shalt reign in quiet while thou livest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">I am content: Richard Plantagenet,</div>
                              <div class="line">Enjoy the kingdom after my decease.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">What wrong is this unto the prince your son!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">What good is this to England and himself!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Base, fearful and despairing Henry!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">How hast thou injured both thyself and us!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot stay to hear these articles.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, cousin, let us tell the queen these news.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell, faint-hearted and degenerate king,</div>
                              <div class="line">In whose cold blood no spark of honour bides.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Be thou a prey unto the house of York,</div>
                              <div class="line">And die in bands for this unmanly deed!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">In dreadful war mayst thou be overcome,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or live in peace abandon'd and despised!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt NORTHUMBERLAND, CLIFFORD, and WESTMORELAND</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Turn this way, Henry, and regard them not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                              <div class="line">They seek revenge and therefore will not yield.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, Exeter!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Why should you sigh, my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Not for myself, Lord Warwick, but my son,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom I unnaturally shall disinherit.</div>
                              <div class="line">But be it as it may: I here entail</div>
                              <div class="line">The crown to thee and to thine heirs for ever;</div>
                              <div class="line">Conditionally, that here thou take an oath</div>
                              <div class="line">To cease this civil war, and, whilst I live,</div>
                              <div class="line">To honour me as thy king and sovereign,</div>
                              <div class="line">And neither by treason nor hostility</div>
                              <div class="line">To seek to put me down and reign thyself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">This oath I willingly take and will perform.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Long live King Henry! Plantagenet embrace him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">And long live thou and these thy forward sons!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Now York and Lancaster are reconciled.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                              <div class="line">Accursed be he that seeks to make them foes!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Sennet. Here they come down</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell, my gracious lord; I'll to my castle.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">And I'll keep London with my soldiers.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">And I to Norfolk with my followers.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">And I unto the sea from whence I came.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt YORK, EDWARD, EDMUND, GEORGE, RICHARD,
WARWICK, NORFOLK, MONTAGUE, their Soldiers, and
Attendants</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">And I, with grief and sorrow, to the court.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter QUEEN MARGARET and PRINCE EDWARD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                              <div class="line">Here comes the queen, whose looks bewray her anger:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll steal away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Exeter, so will I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, go not from me; I will follow thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Be patient, gentle queen, and I will stay.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Who can be patient in such extremes?</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, wretched man! would I had died a maid</div>
                              <div class="line">And never seen thee, never borne thee son,</div>
                              <div class="line">Seeing thou hast proved so unnatural a father</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath he deserved to lose his birthright thus?</div>
                              <div class="line">Hadst thou but loved him half so well as I,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or felt that pain which I did for him once,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or nourish'd him as I did with my blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou wouldst have left thy dearest heart-blood there,</div>
                              <div class="line">Rather than have that savage duke thine heir</div>
                              <div class="line">And disinherited thine only son.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Father, you cannot disinherit me:</div>
                              <div class="line">If you be king, why should not I succeed?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Pardon me, Margaret; pardon me, sweet son:</div>
                              <div class="line">The Earl of Warwick and the duke enforced me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Enforced thee! art thou king, and wilt be forced?</div>
                              <div class="line">I shame to hear thee speak. Ah, timorous wretch!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast undone thyself, thy son and me;</div>
                              <div class="line">And given unto the house of York such head</div>
                              <div class="line">As thou shalt reign but by their sufferance.</div>
                              <div class="line">To entail him and his heirs unto the crown,</div>
                              <div class="line">What is it, but to make thy sepulchre</div>
                              <div class="line">And creep into it far before thy time?</div>
                              <div class="line">Warwick is chancellor and the lord of Calais;</div>
                              <div class="line">Stern Falconbridge commands the narrow seas;</div>
                              <div class="line">The duke is made protector of the realm;</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet shalt thou be safe? such safety finds</div>
                              <div class="line">The trembling lamb environed with wolves.</div>
                              <div class="line">Had I been there, which am a silly woman,</div>
                              <div class="line">The soldiers should have toss'd me on their pikes</div>
                              <div class="line">Before I would have granted to that act.</div>
                              <div class="line">But thou preferr'st thy life before thine honour:</div>
                              <div class="line">And seeing thou dost, I here divorce myself</div>
                              <div class="line">Both from thy table, Henry, and thy bed,</div>
                              <div class="line">Until that act of parliament be repeal'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Whereby my son is disinherited.</div>
                              <div class="line">The northern lords that have forsworn thy colours</div>
                              <div class="line">Will follow mine, if once they see them spread;</div>
                              <div class="line">And spread they shall be, to thy foul disgrace</div>
                              <div class="line">And utter ruin of the house of York.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus do I leave thee. Come, son, let's away;</div>
                              <div class="line">Our army is ready; come, we'll after them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay, gentle Margaret, and hear me speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast spoke too much already: get thee gone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Gentle son Edward, thou wilt stay with me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, to be murder'd by his enemies.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">When I return with victory from the field</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll see your grace: till then I'll follow her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, son, away; we may not linger thus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt QUEEN MARGARET and PRINCE EDWARD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Poor queen! how love to me and to her son</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath made her break out into terms of rage!</div>
                              <div class="line">Revenged may she be on that hateful duke,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose haughty spirit, winged with desire,</div>
                              <div class="line">Will cost my crown, and like an empty eagle</div>
                              <div class="line">Tire on the flesh of me and of my son!</div>
                              <div class="line">The loss of those three lords torments my heart:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll write unto them and entreat them fair.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, cousin you shall be the messenger.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                              <div class="line">And I, I hope, shall reconcile them all.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  Sandal Castle.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter RICHARD, EDWARD, and MONTAGUE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Brother, though I be youngest, give me leave.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">No, I can better play the orator.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">But I have reasons strong and forcible.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter YORK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, how now, sons and brother! at a strife?</div>
                              <div class="line">What is your quarrel? how began it first?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">No quarrel, but a slight contention.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">About what?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">About that which concerns your grace and us;</div>
                              <div class="line">The crown of England, father, which is yours.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Mine boy? not till King Henry be dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Your right depends not on his life or death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Now you are heir, therefore enjoy it now:</div>
                              <div class="line">By giving the house of Lancaster leave to breathe,</div>
                              <div class="line">It will outrun you, father, in the end.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">I took an oath that he should quietly reign.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">But for a kingdom any oath may be broken:</div>
                              <div class="line">I would break a thousand oaths to reign one year.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">No; God forbid your grace should be forsworn.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall be, if I claim by open war.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll prove the contrary, if you'll hear me speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou canst not, son; it is impossible.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">An oath is of no moment, being not took</div>
                              <div class="line">Before a true and lawful magistrate,</div>
                              <div class="line">That hath authority over him that swears:</div>
                              <div class="line">Henry had none, but did usurp the place;</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, seeing 'twas he that made you to depose,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your oath, my lord, is vain and frivolous.</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, to arms! And, father, do but think</div>
                              <div class="line">How sweet a thing it is to wear a crown;</div>
                              <div class="line">Within whose circuit is Elysium</div>
                              <div class="line">And all that poets feign of bliss and joy.</div>
                              <div class="line">Why do we finger thus? I cannot rest</div>
                              <div class="line">Until the white rose that I wear be dyed</div>
                              <div class="line">Even in the lukewarm blood of Henry's heart.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Richard, enough; I will be king, or die.</div>
                              <div class="line">Brother, thou shalt to London presently,</div>
                              <div class="line">And whet on Warwick to this enterprise.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou, Richard, shalt to the Duke of Norfolk,</div>
                              <div class="line">And tell him privily of our intent.</div>
                              <div class="line">You Edward, shall unto my Lord Cobham,</div>
                              <div class="line">With whom the Kentishmen will willingly rise:</div>
                              <div class="line">In them I trust; for they are soldiers,</div>
                              <div class="line">Witty, courteous, liberal, full of spirit.</div>
                              <div class="line">While you are thus employ'd, what resteth more,</div>
                              <div class="line">But that I seek occasion how to rise,</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet the king not privy to my drift,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor any of the house of Lancaster?</div>
                              <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                              <div class="line">But, stay: what news? Why comest thou in such post?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">The queen with all the northern earls and lords</div>
                              <div class="line">Intend here to besiege you in your castle:</div>
                              <div class="line">She is hard by with twenty thousand men;</div>
                              <div class="line">And therefore fortify your hold, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, with my sword. What! think'st thou that we fear them?</div>
                              <div class="line">Edward and Richard, you shall stay with me;</div>
                              <div class="line">My brother Montague shall post to London:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let noble Warwick, Cobham, and the rest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom we have left protectors of the king,</div>
                              <div class="line">With powerful policy strengthen themselves,</div>
                              <div class="line">And trust not simple Henry nor his oaths.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">Brother, I go; I'll win them, fear it not:</div>
                              <div class="line">And thus most humbly I do take my leave.</div>
                              <p>Exit</p>
                              <p>Enter JOHN MORTIMER and HUGH MORTIMER</p>
                              <div class="line">Sir John and Sir Hugh Mortimer, mine uncles,</div>
                              <div class="line">You are come to Sandal in a happy hour;</div>
                              <div class="line">The army of the queen mean to besiege us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOHN MORTIMER</div>
                              <div class="line">She shall not need; we'll meet her in the field.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">What, with five thousand men?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, with five hundred, father, for a need:</div>
                              <div class="line">A woman's general; what should we fear?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>A march afar off</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">I hear their drums: let's set our men in order,</div>
                              <div class="line">And issue forth and bid them battle straight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Five men to twenty! though the odds be great,</div>
                              <div class="line">I doubt not, uncle, of our victory.</div>
                              <div class="line">Many a battle have I won in France,</div>
                              <div class="line">When as the enemy hath been ten to one:</div>
                              <div class="line">Why should I not now have the like success?</div>
                              <p>Alarum. Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Alarums. Enter RUTLAND and his Tutor</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RUTLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, whither shall I fly to 'scape their hands?</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, tutor, look where bloody Clifford comes!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter CLIFFORD and Soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Chaplain, away! thy priesthood saves thy life.</div>
                              <div class="line">As for the brat of this accursed duke,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose father slew my father, he shall die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Tutor</div>
                              <div class="line">And I, my lord, will bear him company.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Soldiers, away with him!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Tutor</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, Clifford, murder not this innocent child,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest thou be hated both of God and man!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit, dragged off by Soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">How now! is he dead already? or is it fear</div>
                              <div class="line">That makes him close his eyes? I'll open them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RUTLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">So looks the pent-up lion o'er the wretch</div>
                              <div class="line">That trembles under his devouring paws;</div>
                              <div class="line">And so he walks, insulting o'er his prey,</div>
                              <div class="line">And so he comes, to rend his limbs asunder.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, gentle Clifford, kill me with thy sword,</div>
                              <div class="line">And not with such a cruel threatening look.</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet Clifford, hear me speak before I die.</div>
                              <div class="line">I am too mean a subject for thy wrath:</div>
                              <div class="line">Be thou revenged on men, and let me live.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">In vain thou speak'st, poor boy; my father's blood</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath stopp'd the passage where thy words should enter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RUTLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Then let my father's blood open it again:</div>
                              <div class="line">He is a man, and, Clifford, cope with him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Had thy brethren here, their lives and thine</div>
                              <div class="line">Were not revenge sufficient for me;</div>
                              <div class="line">No, if I digg'd up thy forefathers' graves</div>
                              <div class="line">And hung their rotten coffins up in chains,</div>
                              <div class="line">It could not slake mine ire, nor ease my heart.</div>
                              <div class="line">The sight of any of the house of York</div>
                              <div class="line">Is as a fury to torment my soul;</div>
                              <div class="line">And till I root out their accursed line</div>
                              <div class="line">And leave not one alive, I live in hell.</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Lifting his hand</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RUTLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">O, let me pray before I take my death!</div>
                              <div class="line">To thee I pray; sweet Clifford, pity me!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Such pity as my rapier's point affords.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RUTLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">I never did thee harm: why wilt thou slay me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy father hath.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RUTLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">But 'twas ere I was born.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast one son; for his sake pity me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest in revenge thereof, sith God is just,</div>
                              <div class="line">He be as miserably slain as I.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, let me live in prison all my days;</div>
                              <div class="line">And when I give occasion of offence,</div>
                              <div class="line">Then let me die, for now thou hast no cause.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">No cause!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy father slew my father; therefore, die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Stabs him</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RUTLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Di faciant laudis summa sit ista tuae!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Dies</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Plantagenet! I come, Plantagenet!</div>
                              <div class="line">And this thy son's blood cleaving to my blade</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall rust upon my weapon, till thy blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Congeal'd with this, do make me wipe off both.</div>
                              <p>Exit</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Alarum. Enter YORK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">The army of the queen hath got the field:</div>
                              <div class="line">My uncles both are slain in rescuing me;</div>
                              <div class="line">And all my followers to the eager foe</div>
                              <div class="line">Turn back and fly, like ships before the wind</div>
                              <div class="line">Or lambs pursued by hunger-starved wolves.</div>
                              <div class="line">My sons, God knows what hath bechanced them:</div>
                              <div class="line">But this I know, they have demean'd themselves</div>
                              <div class="line">Like men born to renown by life or death.</div>
                              <div class="line">Three times did Richard make a lane to me.</div>
                              <div class="line">And thrice cried 'Courage, father! fight it out!'</div>
                              <div class="line">And full as oft came Edward to my side,</div>
                              <div class="line">With purple falchion, painted to the hilt</div>
                              <div class="line">In blood of those that had encounter'd him:</div>
                              <div class="line">And when the hardiest warriors did retire,</div>
                              <div class="line">Richard cried 'Charge! and give no foot of ground!'</div>
                              <div class="line">And cried 'A crown, or else a glorious tomb!</div>
                              <div class="line">A sceptre, or an earthly sepulchre!'</div>
                              <div class="line">With this, we charged again: but, out, alas!</div>
                              <div class="line">We bodged again; as I have seen a swan</div>
                              <div class="line">With bootless labour swim against the tide</div>
                              <div class="line">And spend her strength with over-matching waves.</div>
                              <p>A short alarum within</p>
                              <div class="line">Ah, hark! the fatal followers do pursue;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I am faint and cannot fly their fury:</div>
                              <div class="line">And were I strong, I would not shun their fury:</div>
                              <div class="line">The sands are number'd that make up my life;</div>
                              <div class="line">Here must I stay, and here my life must end.</div>
                              <p>Enter QUEEN MARGARET, CLIFFORD, NORTHUMBERLAND,
PRINCE EDWARD, and Soldiers</p>
                              <div class="line">Come, bloody Clifford, rough Northumberland,</div>
                              <div class="line">I dare your quenchless fury to more rage:</div>
                              <div class="line">I am your butt, and I abide your shot.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Yield to our mercy, proud Plantagenet.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, to such mercy as his ruthless arm,</div>
                              <div class="line">With downright payment, show'd unto my father.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now Phaethon hath tumbled from his car,</div>
                              <div class="line">And made an evening at the noontide prick.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">My ashes, as the phoenix, may bring forth</div>
                              <div class="line">A bird that will revenge upon you all:</div>
                              <div class="line">And in that hope I throw mine eyes to heaven,</div>
                              <div class="line">Scorning whate'er you can afflict me with.</div>
                              <div class="line">Why come you not? what! multitudes, and fear?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">So cowards fight when they can fly no further;</div>
                              <div class="line">So doves do peck the falcon's piercing talons;</div>
                              <div class="line">So desperate thieves, all hopeless of their lives,</div>
                              <div class="line">Breathe out invectives 'gainst the officers.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">O Clifford, but bethink thee once again,</div>
                              <div class="line">And in thy thought o'er-run my former time;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, if though canst for blushing, view this face,</div>
                              <div class="line">And bite thy tongue, that slanders him with cowardice</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose frown hath made thee faint and fly ere this!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not bandy with thee word for word,</div>
                              <div class="line">But buckle with thee blows, twice two for one.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Hold, valiant Clifford! for a thousand causes</div>
                              <div class="line">I would prolong awhile the traitor's life.</div>
                              <div class="line">Wrath makes him deaf: speak thou, Northumberland.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Hold, Clifford! do not honour him so much</div>
                              <div class="line">To prick thy finger, though to wound his heart:</div>
                              <div class="line">What valour were it, when a cur doth grin,</div>
                              <div class="line">For one to thrust his hand between his teeth,</div>
                              <div class="line">When he might spurn him with his foot away?</div>
                              <div class="line">It is war's prize to take all vantages;</div>
                              <div class="line">And ten to one is no impeach of valour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>They lay hands on YORK, who struggles</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, ay, so strives the woodcock with the gin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">So doth the cony struggle in the net.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">So triumph thieves upon their conquer'd booty;</div>
                              <div class="line">So true men yield, with robbers so o'ermatch'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">What would your grace have done unto him now?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Brave warriors, Clifford and Northumberland,</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, make him stand upon this molehill here,</div>
                              <div class="line">That raught at mountains with outstretched arms,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet parted but the shadow with his hand.</div>
                              <div class="line">What! was it you that would be England's king?</div>
                              <div class="line">Was't you that revell'd in our parliament,</div>
                              <div class="line">And made a preachment of your high descent?</div>
                              <div class="line">Where are your mess of sons to back you now?</div>
                              <div class="line">The wanton Edward, and the lusty George?</div>
                              <div class="line">And where's that valiant crook-back prodigy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Dicky your boy, that with his grumbling voice</div>
                              <div class="line">Was wont to cheer his dad in mutinies?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or, with the rest, where is your darling Rutland?</div>
                              <div class="line">Look, York: I stain'd this napkin with the blood</div>
                              <div class="line">That valiant Clifford, with his rapier's point,</div>
                              <div class="line">Made issue from the bosom of the boy;</div>
                              <div class="line">And if thine eyes can water for his death,</div>
                              <div class="line">I give thee this to dry thy cheeks withal.</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas poor York! but that I hate thee deadly,</div>
                              <div class="line">I should lament thy miserable state.</div>
                              <div class="line">I prithee, grieve, to make me merry, York.</div>
                              <div class="line">What, hath thy fiery heart so parch'd thine entrails</div>
                              <div class="line">That not a tear can fall for Rutland's death?</div>
                              <div class="line">Why art thou patient, man? thou shouldst be mad;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I, to make thee mad, do mock thee thus.</div>
                              <div class="line">Stamp, rave, and fret, that I may sing and dance.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou wouldst be fee'd, I see, to make me sport:</div>
                              <div class="line">York cannot speak, unless he wear a crown.</div>
                              <div class="line">A crown for York! and, lords, bow low to him:</div>
                              <div class="line">Hold you his hands, whilst I do set it on.</div>
                              <p>Putting a paper crown on his head</p>
                              <div class="line">Ay, marry, sir, now looks he like a king!</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, this is he that took King Henry's chair,</div>
                              <div class="line">And this is he was his adopted heir.</div>
                              <div class="line">But how is it that great Plantagenet</div>
                              <div class="line">Is crown'd so soon, and broke his solemn oath?</div>
                              <div class="line">As I bethink me, you should not be king</div>
                              <div class="line">Till our King Henry had shook hands with death.</div>
                              <div class="line">And will you pale your head in Henry's glory,</div>
                              <div class="line">And rob his temples of the diadem,</div>
                              <div class="line">Now in his life, against your holy oath?</div>
                              <div class="line">O, 'tis a fault too too unpardonable!</div>
                              <div class="line">Off with the crown, and with the crown his head;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, whilst we breathe, take time to do him dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">That is my office, for my father's sake.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, stay; lets hear the orisons he makes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">She-wolf of France, but worse than wolves of France,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose tongue more poisons than the adder's tooth!</div>
                              <div class="line">How ill-beseeming is it in thy sex</div>
                              <div class="line">To triumph, like an Amazonian trull,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon their woes whom fortune captivates!</div>
                              <div class="line">But that thy face is, vizard-like, unchanging,</div>
                              <div class="line">Made impudent with use of evil deeds,</div>
                              <div class="line">I would assay, proud queen, to make thee blush.</div>
                              <div class="line">To tell thee whence thou camest, of whom derived,</div>
                              <div class="line">Were shame enough to shame thee, wert thou not shameless.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy father bears the type of King of Naples,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of both the Sicils and Jerusalem,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet not so wealthy as an English yeoman.</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath that poor monarch taught thee to insult?</div>
                              <div class="line">It needs not, nor it boots thee not, proud queen,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless the adage must be verified,</div>
                              <div class="line">That beggars mounted run their horse to death.</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis beauty that doth oft make women proud;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, God he knows, thy share thereof is small:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis virtue that doth make them most admired;</div>
                              <div class="line">The contrary doth make thee wonder'd at:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis government that makes them seem divine;</div>
                              <div class="line">The want thereof makes thee abominable:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art as opposite to every good</div>
                              <div class="line">As the Antipodes are unto us,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or as the south to the septentrion.</div>
                              <div class="line">O tiger's heart wrapt in a woman's hide!</div>
                              <div class="line">How couldst thou drain the life-blood of the child,</div>
                              <div class="line">To bid the father wipe his eyes withal,</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet be seen to bear a woman's face?</div>
                              <div class="line">Women are soft, mild, pitiful and flexible;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou stern, obdurate, flinty, rough, remorseless.</div>
                              <div class="line">Bids't thou me rage? why, now thou hast thy wish:</div>
                              <div class="line">Wouldst have me weep? why, now thou hast thy will:</div>
                              <div class="line">For raging wind blows up incessant showers,</div>
                              <div class="line">And when the rage allays, the rain begins.</div>
                              <div class="line">These tears are my sweet Rutland's obsequies:</div>
                              <div class="line">And every drop cries vengeance for his death,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Gainst thee, fell Clifford, and thee, false</div>
                              <div class="line">Frenchwoman.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Beshrew me, but his passion moves me so</div>
                              <div class="line">That hardly can I cheque my eyes from tears.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">That face of his the hungry cannibals</div>
                              <div class="line">Would not have touch'd, would not have stain'd with blood:</div>
                              <div class="line">But you are more inhuman, more inexorable,</div>
                              <div class="line">O, ten times more, than tigers of Hyrcania.</div>
                              <div class="line">See, ruthless queen, a hapless father's tears:</div>
                              <div class="line">This cloth thou dip'dst in blood of my sweet boy,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I with tears do wash the blood away.</div>
                              <div class="line">Keep thou the napkin, and go boast of this:</div>
                              <div class="line">And if thou tell'st the heavy story right,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon my soul, the hearers will shed tears;</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea even my foes will shed fast-falling tears,</div>
                              <div class="line">And say 'Alas, it was a piteous deed!'</div>
                              <div class="line">There, take the crown, and, with the crown, my curse;</div>
                              <div class="line">And in thy need such comfort come to thee</div>
                              <div class="line">As now I reap at thy too cruel hand!</div>
                              <div class="line">Hard-hearted Clifford, take me from the world:</div>
                              <div class="line">My soul to heaven, my blood upon your heads!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Had he been slaughter-man to all my kin,</div>
                              <div class="line">I should not for my life but weep with him.</div>
                              <div class="line">To see how inly sorrow gripes his soul.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">What, weeping-ripe, my Lord Northumberland?</div>
                              <div class="line">Think but upon the wrong he did us all,</div>
                              <div class="line">And that will quickly dry thy melting tears.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's for my oath, here's for my father's death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Stabbing him</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">And here's to right our gentle-hearted king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Stabbing him</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Open Thy gate of mercy, gracious God!</div>
                              <div class="line">My soul flies through these wounds to seek out Thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Dies</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Off with his head, and set it on York gates;</div>
                              <div class="line">So York may overlook the town of York.</div>
                              <p>Flourish. Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  Before York.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.5">4. SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.6">5. SCENE V.  Another part of the field.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.7">6. SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>A march. Enter EDWARD, RICHARD, and their power</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">I wonder how our princely father 'scaped,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or whether he be 'scaped away or no</div>
                              <div class="line">From Clifford's and Northumberland's pursuit:</div>
                              <div class="line">Had he been ta'en, we should have heard the news;</div>
                              <div class="line">Had he been slain, we should have heard the news;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or had he 'scaped, methinks we should have heard</div>
                              <div class="line">The happy tidings of his good escape.</div>
                              <div class="line">How fares my brother? why is he so sad?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot joy, until I be resolved</div>
                              <div class="line">Where our right valiant father is become.</div>
                              <div class="line">I saw him in the battle range about;</div>
                              <div class="line">And watch'd him how he singled Clifford forth.</div>
                              <div class="line">Methought he bore him in the thickest troop</div>
                              <div class="line">As doth a lion in a herd of neat;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or as a bear, encompass'd round with dogs,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who having pinch'd a few and made them cry,</div>
                              <div class="line">The rest stand all aloof, and bark at him.</div>
                              <div class="line">So fared our father with his enemies;</div>
                              <div class="line">So fled his enemies my warlike father:</div>
                              <div class="line">Methinks, 'tis prize enough to be his son.</div>
                              <div class="line">See how the morning opes her golden gates,</div>
                              <div class="line">And takes her farewell of the glorious sun!</div>
                              <div class="line">How well resembles it the prime of youth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Trimm'd like a younker prancing to his love!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Dazzle mine eyes, or do I see three suns?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Three glorious suns, each one a perfect sun;</div>
                              <div class="line">Not separated with the racking clouds,</div>
                              <div class="line">But sever'd in a pale clear-shining sky.</div>
                              <div class="line">See, see! they join, embrace, and seem to kiss,</div>
                              <div class="line">As if they vow'd some league inviolable:</div>
                              <div class="line">Now are they but one lamp, one light, one sun.</div>
                              <div class="line">In this the heaven figures some event.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis wondrous strange, the like yet never heard of.</div>
                              <div class="line">I think it cites us, brother, to the field,</div>
                              <div class="line">That we, the sons of brave Plantagenet,</div>
                              <div class="line">Each one already blazing by our meeds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Should notwithstanding join our lights together</div>
