                              <div class="line">And over-shine the earth as this the world.</div>
                              <div class="line">Whate'er it bodes, henceforward will I bear</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon my target three fair-shining suns.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, bear three daughters: by your leave I speak it,</div>
                              <div class="line">You love the breeder better than the male.</div>
                              <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                              <div class="line">But what art thou, whose heavy looks foretell</div>
                              <div class="line">Some dreadful story hanging on thy tongue?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, one that was a woful looker-on</div>
                              <div class="line">When as the noble Duke of York was slain,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your princely father and my loving lord!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">O, speak no more, for I have heard too much.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Say how he died, for I will hear it all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">Environed he was with many foes,</div>
                              <div class="line">And stood against them, as the hope of Troy</div>
                              <div class="line">Against the Greeks that would have enter'd Troy.</div>
                              <div class="line">But Hercules himself must yield to odds;</div>
                              <div class="line">And many strokes, though with a little axe,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hew down and fell the hardest-timber'd oak.</div>
                              <div class="line">By many hands your father was subdued;</div>
                              <div class="line">But only slaughter'd by the ireful arm</div>
                              <div class="line">Of unrelenting Clifford and the queen,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who crown'd the gracious duke in high despite,</div>
                              <div class="line">Laugh'd in his face; and when with grief he wept,</div>
                              <div class="line">The ruthless queen gave him to dry his cheeks</div>
                              <div class="line">A napkin steeped in the harmless blood</div>
                              <div class="line">Of sweet young Rutland, by rough Clifford slain:</div>
                              <div class="line">And after many scorns, many foul taunts,</div>
                              <div class="line">They took his head, and on the gates of York</div>
                              <div class="line">They set the same; and there it doth remain,</div>
                              <div class="line">The saddest spectacle that e'er I view'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet Duke of York, our prop to lean upon,</div>
                              <div class="line">Now thou art gone, we have no staff, no stay.</div>
                              <div class="line">O Clifford, boisterous Clifford! thou hast slain</div>
                              <div class="line">The flower of Europe for his chivalry;</div>
                              <div class="line">And treacherously hast thou vanquish'd him,</div>
                              <div class="line">For hand to hand he would have vanquish'd thee.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now my soul's palace is become a prison:</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, would she break from hence, that this my body</div>
                              <div class="line">Might in the ground be closed up in rest!</div>
                              <div class="line">For never henceforth shall I joy again,</div>
                              <div class="line">Never, O never shall I see more joy!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot weep; for all my body's moisture</div>
                              <div class="line">Scarce serves to quench my furnace-burning heart:</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor can my tongue unload my heart's great burthen;</div>
                              <div class="line">For selfsame wind that I should speak withal</div>
                              <div class="line">Is kindling coals that fires all my breast,</div>
                              <div class="line">And burns me up with flames that tears would quench.</div>
                              <div class="line">To weep is to make less the depth of grief:</div>
                              <div class="line">Tears then for babes; blows and revenge for me</div>
                              <div class="line">Richard, I bear thy name; I'll venge thy death,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or die renowned by attempting it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">His name that valiant duke hath left with thee;</div>
                              <div class="line">His dukedom and his chair with me is left.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, if thou be that princely eagle's bird,</div>
                              <div class="line">Show thy descent by gazing 'gainst the sun:</div>
                              <div class="line">For chair and dukedom, throne and kingdom say;</div>
                              <div class="line">Either that is thine, or else thou wert not his.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>March. Enter WARWICK, MONTAGUE, and their army</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">How now, fair lords! What fare? what news abroad?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Great Lord of Warwick, if we should recount</div>
                              <div class="line">Our baleful news, and at each word's deliverance</div>
                              <div class="line">Stab poniards in our flesh till all were told,</div>
                              <div class="line">The words would add more anguish than the wounds.</div>
                              <div class="line">O valiant lord, the Duke of York is slain!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">O Warwick, Warwick! that Plantagenet,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which held three dearly as his soul's redemption,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is by the stern Lord Clifford done to death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Ten days ago I drown'd these news in tears;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now, to add more measure to your woes,</div>
                              <div class="line">I come to tell you things sith then befall'n.</div>
                              <div class="line">After the bloody fray at Wakefield fought,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where your brave father breathed his latest gasp,</div>
                              <div class="line">Tidings, as swiftly as the posts could run,</div>
                              <div class="line">Were brought me of your loss and his depart.</div>
                              <div class="line">I, then in London keeper of the king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Muster'd my soldiers, gather'd flocks of friends,</div>
                              <div class="line">And very well appointed, as I thought,</div>
                              <div class="line">March'd toward Saint Alban's to intercept the queen,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bearing the king in my behalf along;</div>
                              <div class="line">For by my scouts I was advertised</div>
                              <div class="line">That she was coming with a full intent</div>
                              <div class="line">To dash our late decree in parliament</div>
                              <div class="line">Touching King Henry's oath and your succession.</div>
                              <div class="line">Short tale to make, we at Saint Alban's met</div>
                              <div class="line">Our battles join'd, and both sides fiercely fought:</div>
                              <div class="line">But whether 'twas the coldness of the king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who look'd full gently on his warlike queen,</div>
                              <div class="line">That robb'd my soldiers of their heated spleen;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or whether 'twas report of her success;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or more than common fear of Clifford's rigour,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who thunders to his captives blood and death,</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot judge: but to conclude with truth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Their weapons like to lightning came and went;</div>
                              <div class="line">Our soldiers', like the night-owl's lazy flight,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or like an idle thresher with a flail,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fell gently down, as if they struck their friends.</div>
                              <div class="line">I cheer'd them up with justice of our cause,</div>
                              <div class="line">With promise of high pay and great rewards:</div>
                              <div class="line">But all in vain; they had no heart to fight,</div>
                              <div class="line">And we in them no hope to win the day;</div>
                              <div class="line">So that we fled; the king unto the queen;</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord George your brother, Norfolk and myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">In haste, post-haste, are come to join with you:</div>
                              <div class="line">For in the marches here we heard you were,</div>
                              <div class="line">Making another head to fight again.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is the Duke of Norfolk, gentle Warwick?</div>
                              <div class="line">And when came George from Burgundy to England?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Some six miles off the duke is with the soldiers;</div>
                              <div class="line">And for your brother, he was lately sent</div>
                              <div class="line">From your kind aunt, Duchess of Burgundy,</div>
                              <div class="line">With aid of soldiers to this needful war.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twas odds, belike, when valiant Warwick fled:</div>
                              <div class="line">Oft have I heard his praises in pursuit,</div>
                              <div class="line">But ne'er till now his scandal of retire.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor now my scandal, Richard, dost thou hear;</div>
                              <div class="line">For thou shalt know this strong right hand of mine</div>
                              <div class="line">Can pluck the diadem from faint Henry's head,</div>
                              <div class="line">And wring the awful sceptre from his fist,</div>
                              <div class="line">Were he as famous and as bold in war</div>
                              <div class="line">As he is famed for mildness, peace, and prayer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">I know it well, Lord Warwick; blame me not:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis love I bear thy glories makes me speak.</div>
                              <div class="line">But in this troublous time what's to be done?</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall we go throw away our coats of steel,</div>
                              <div class="line">And wrap our bodies in black mourning gowns,</div>
                              <div class="line">Numbering our Ave-Maries with our beads?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or shall we on the helmets of our foes</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell our devotion with revengeful arms?</div>
                              <div class="line">If for the last, say ay, and to it, lords.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, therefore Warwick came to seek you out;</div>
                              <div class="line">And therefore comes my brother Montague.</div>
                              <div class="line">Attend me, lords. The proud insulting queen,</div>
                              <div class="line">With Clifford and the haught Northumberland,</div>
                              <div class="line">And of their feather many more proud birds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have wrought the easy-melting king like wax.</div>
                              <div class="line">He swore consent to your succession,</div>
                              <div class="line">His oath enrolled in the parliament;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now to London all the crew are gone,</div>
                              <div class="line">To frustrate both his oath and what beside</div>
                              <div class="line">May make against the house of Lancaster.</div>
                              <div class="line">Their power, I think, is thirty thousand strong:</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, if the help of Norfolk and myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">With all the friends that thou, brave Earl of March,</div>
                              <div class="line">Amongst the loving Welshmen canst procure,</div>
                              <div class="line">Will but amount to five and twenty thousand,</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, Via! to London will we march amain,</div>
                              <div class="line">And once again bestride our foaming steeds,</div>
                              <div class="line">And once again cry 'Charge upon our foes!'</div>
                              <div class="line">But never once again turn back and fly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, now methinks I hear great Warwick speak:</div>
                              <div class="line">Ne'er may he live to see a sunshine day,</div>
                              <div class="line">That cries 'Retire,' if Warwick bid him stay.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord Warwick, on thy shoulder will I lean;</div>
                              <div class="line">And when thou fail'st--as God forbid the hour!--</div>
                              <div class="line">Must Edward fall, which peril heaven forfend!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">No longer Earl of March, but Duke of York:</div>
                              <div class="line">The next degree is England's royal throne;</div>
                              <div class="line">For King of England shalt thou be proclaim'd</div>
                              <div class="line">In every borough as we pass along;</div>
                              <div class="line">And he that throws not up his cap for joy</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall for the fault make forfeit of his head.</div>
                              <div class="line">King Edward, valiant Richard, Montague,</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay we no longer, dreaming of renown,</div>
                              <div class="line">But sound the trumpets, and about our task.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, Clifford, were thy heart as hard as steel,</div>
                              <div class="line">As thou hast shown it flinty by thy deeds,</div>
                              <div class="line">I come to pierce it, or to give thee mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Then strike up drums: God and Saint George for us!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">How now! what news?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">The Duke of Norfolk sends you word by me,</div>
                              <div class="line">The queen is coming with a puissant host;</div>
                              <div class="line">And craves your company for speedy counsel.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Why then it sorts, brave warriors, let's away.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  Before York.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Flourish. Enter KING HENRY VI, QUEEN MARGARET,
PRINCE EDWARD, CLIFFORD, and NORTHUMBERLAND, with
drum and trumpets</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Welcome, my lord, to this brave town of York.</div>
                              <div class="line">Yonder's the head of that arch-enemy</div>
                              <div class="line">That sought to be encompass'd with your crown:</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth not the object cheer your heart, my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, as the rocks cheer them that fear their wreck:</div>
                              <div class="line">To see this sight, it irks my very soul.</div>
                              <div class="line">Withhold revenge, dear God! 'tis not my fault,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor wittingly have I infringed my vow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">My gracious liege, this too much lenity</div>
                              <div class="line">And harmful pity must be laid aside.</div>
                              <div class="line">To whom do lions cast their gentle looks?</div>
                              <div class="line">Not to the beast that would usurp their den.</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose hand is that the forest bear doth lick?</div>
                              <div class="line">Not his that spoils her young before her face.</div>
                              <div class="line">Who 'scapes the lurking serpent's mortal sting?</div>
                              <div class="line">Not he that sets his foot upon her back.</div>
                              <div class="line">The smallest worm will turn being trodden on,</div>
                              <div class="line">And doves will peck in safeguard of their brood.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ambitious York doth level at thy crown,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou smiling while he knit his angry brows:</div>
                              <div class="line">He, but a duke, would have his son a king,</div>
                              <div class="line">And raise his issue, like a loving sire;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou, being a king, blest with a goodly son,</div>
                              <div class="line">Didst yield consent to disinherit him,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which argued thee a most unloving father.</div>
                              <div class="line">Unreasonable creatures feed their young;</div>
                              <div class="line">And though man's face be fearful to their eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, in protection of their tender ones,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who hath not seen them, even with those wings</div>
                              <div class="line">Which sometime they have used with fearful flight,</div>
                              <div class="line">Make war with him that climb'd unto their nest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Offer their own lives in their young's defence?</div>
                              <div class="line">For shame, my liege, make them your precedent!</div>
                              <div class="line">Were it not pity that this goodly boy</div>
                              <div class="line">Should lose his birthright by his father's fault,</div>
                              <div class="line">And long hereafter say unto his child,</div>
                              <div class="line">'What my great-grandfather and his grandsire got</div>
                              <div class="line">My careless father fondly gave away'?</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, what a shame were this! Look on the boy;</div>
                              <div class="line">And let his manly face, which promiseth</div>
                              <div class="line">Successful fortune, steel thy melting heart</div>
                              <div class="line">To hold thine own and leave thine own with him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Full well hath Clifford play'd the orator,</div>
                              <div class="line">Inferring arguments of mighty force.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, Clifford, tell me, didst thou never hear</div>
                              <div class="line">That things ill-got had ever bad success?</div>
                              <div class="line">And happy always was it for that son</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose father for his hoarding went to hell?</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll leave my son my virtuous deeds behind;</div>
                              <div class="line">And would my father had left me no more!</div>
                              <div class="line">For all the rest is held at such a rate</div>
                              <div class="line">As brings a thousand-fold more care to keep</div>
                              <div class="line">Than in possession and jot of pleasure.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, cousin York! would thy best friends did know</div>
                              <div class="line">How it doth grieve me that thy head is here!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, cheer up your spirits: our foes are nigh,</div>
                              <div class="line">And this soft courage makes your followers faint.</div>
                              <div class="line">You promised knighthood to our forward son:</div>
                              <div class="line">Unsheathe your sword, and dub him presently.</div>
                              <div class="line">Edward, kneel down.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Edward Plantagenet, arise a knight;</div>
                              <div class="line">And learn this lesson, draw thy sword in right.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                              <div class="line">My gracious father, by your kingly leave,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll draw it as apparent to the crown,</div>
                              <div class="line">And in that quarrel use it to the death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, that is spoken like a toward prince.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">Royal commanders, be in readiness:</div>
                              <div class="line">For with a band of thirty thousand men</div>
                              <div class="line">Comes Warwick, backing of the Duke of York;</div>
                              <div class="line">And in the towns, as they do march along,</div>
                              <div class="line">Proclaims him king, and many fly to him:</div>
                              <div class="line">Darraign your battle, for they are at hand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">I would your highness would depart the field:</div>
                              <div class="line">The queen hath best success when you are absent.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, good my lord, and leave us to our fortune.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, that's my fortune too; therefore I'll stay.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Be it with resolution then to fight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">My royal father, cheer these noble lords</div>
                              <div class="line">And hearten those that fight in your defence:</div>
                              <div class="line">Unsheathe your sword, good father; cry 'Saint George!'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>March. Enter EDWARD, GEORGE, RICHARD, WARWICK,
NORFOLK, MONTAGUE, and Soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, perjured Henry! wilt thou kneel for grace,</div>
                              <div class="line">And set thy diadem upon my head;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or bide the mortal fortune of the field?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, rate thy minions, proud insulting boy!</div>
                              <div class="line">Becomes it thee to be thus bold in terms</div>
                              <div class="line">Before thy sovereign and thy lawful king?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">I am his king, and he should bow his knee;</div>
                              <div class="line">I was adopted heir by his consent:</div>
                              <div class="line">Since when, his oath is broke; for, as I hear,</div>
                              <div class="line">You, that are king, though he do wear the crown,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have caused him, by new act of parliament,</div>
                              <div class="line">To blot out me, and put his own son in.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">And reason too:</div>
                              <div class="line">Who should succeed the father but the son?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Are you there, butcher? O, I cannot speak!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, crook-back, here I stand to answer thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or any he the proudest of thy sort.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twas you that kill'd young Rutland, was it not?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, and old York, and yet not satisfied.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">For God's sake, lords, give signal to the fight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">What say'st thou, Henry, wilt thou yield the crown?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, how now, long-tongued Warwick! dare you speak?</div>
                              <div class="line">When you and I met at Saint Alban's last,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your legs did better service than your hands.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Then 'twas my turn to fly, and now 'tis thine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">You said so much before, and yet you fled.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twas not your valour, Clifford, drove me thence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">No, nor your manhood that durst make you stay.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Northumberland, I hold thee reverently.</div>
                              <div class="line">Break off the parley; for scarce I can refrain</div>
                              <div class="line">The execution of my big-swoln heart</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon that Clifford, that cruel child-killer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">I slew thy father, call'st thou him a child?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, like a dastard and a treacherous coward,</div>
                              <div class="line">As thou didst kill our tender brother Rutland;</div>
                              <div class="line">But ere sunset I'll make thee curse the deed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Have done with words, my lords, and hear me speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Defy them then, or else hold close thy lips.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">I prithee, give no limits to my tongue:</div>
                              <div class="line">I am a king, and privileged to speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">My liege, the wound that bred this meeting here</div>
                              <div class="line">Cannot be cured by words; therefore be still.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, executioner, unsheathe thy sword:</div>
                              <div class="line">By him that made us all, I am resolved</div>
                              <div class="line">that Clifford's manhood lies upon his tongue.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Say, Henry, shall I have my right, or no?</div>
                              <div class="line">A thousand men have broke their fasts to-day,</div>
                              <div class="line">That ne'er shall dine unless thou yield the crown.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou deny, their blood upon thy head;</div>
                              <div class="line">For York in justice puts his armour on.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">If that be right which Warwick says is right,</div>
                              <div class="line">There is no wrong, but every thing is right.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Whoever got thee, there thy mother stands;</div>
                              <div class="line">For, well I wot, thou hast thy mother's tongue.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">But thou art neither like thy sire nor dam;</div>
                              <div class="line">But like a foul mis-shapen stigmatic,</div>
                              <div class="line">Mark'd by the destinies to be avoided,</div>
                              <div class="line">As venom toads, or lizards' dreadful stings.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Iron of Naples hid with English gilt,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose father bears the title of a king,--</div>
                              <div class="line">As if a channel should be call'd the sea,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Shamest thou not, knowing whence thou art extraught,</div>
                              <div class="line">To let thy tongue detect thy base-born heart?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">A wisp of straw were worth a thousand crowns,</div>
                              <div class="line">To make this shameless callet know herself.</div>
                              <div class="line">Helen of Greece was fairer far than thou,</div>
                              <div class="line">Although thy husband may be Menelaus;</div>
                              <div class="line">And ne'er was Agamemnon's brother wrong'd</div>
                              <div class="line">By that false woman, as this king by thee.</div>
                              <div class="line">His father revell'd in the heart of France,</div>
                              <div class="line">And tamed the king, and made the dauphin stoop;</div>
                              <div class="line">And had he match'd according to his state,</div>
                              <div class="line">He might have kept that glory to this day;</div>
                              <div class="line">But when he took a beggar to his bed,</div>
                              <div class="line">And graced thy poor sire with his bridal-day,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even then that sunshine brew'd a shower for him,</div>
                              <div class="line">That wash'd his father's fortunes forth of France,</div>
                              <div class="line">And heap'd sedition on his crown at home.</div>
                              <div class="line">For what hath broach'd this tumult but thy pride?</div>
                              <div class="line">Hadst thou been meek, our title still had slept;</div>
                              <div class="line">And we, in pity of the gentle king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Had slipp'd our claim until another age.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GEORGE</div>
                              <div class="line">But when we saw our sunshine made thy spring,</div>
                              <div class="line">And that thy summer bred us no increase,</div>
                              <div class="line">We set the axe to thy usurping root;</div>
                              <div class="line">And though the edge hath something hit ourselves,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, know thou, since we have begun to strike,</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll never leave till we have hewn thee down,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or bathed thy growing with our heated bloods.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in this resolution, I defy thee;</div>
                              <div class="line">Not willing any longer conference,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since thou deniest the gentle king to speak.</div>
                              <div class="line">Sound trumpets! let our bloody colours wave!</div>
                              <div class="line">And either victory, or else a grave.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay, Edward.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">No, wrangling woman, we'll no longer stay:</div>
                              <div class="line">These words will cost ten thousand lives this day.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Alarum. Excursions. Enter WARWICK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Forspent with toil, as runners with a race,</div>
                              <div class="line">I lay me down a little while to breathe;</div>
                              <div class="line">For strokes received, and many blows repaid,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have robb'd my strong-knit sinews of their strength,</div>
                              <div class="line">And spite of spite needs must I rest awhile.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter EDWARD, running</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Smile, gentle heaven! or strike, ungentle death!</div>
                              <div class="line">For this world frowns, and Edward's sun is clouded.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">How now, my lord! what hap? what hope of good?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter GEORGE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GEORGE</div>
                              <div class="line">Our hap is loss, our hope but sad despair;</div>
                              <div class="line">Our ranks are broke, and ruin follows us:</div>
                              <div class="line">What counsel give you? whither shall we fly?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Bootless is flight, they follow us with wings;</div>
                              <div class="line">And weak we are and cannot shun pursuit.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter RICHARD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, Warwick, why hast thou withdrawn thyself?</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy brother's blood the thirsty earth hath drunk,</div>
                              <div class="line">Broach'd with the steely point of Clifford's lance;</div>
                              <div class="line">And in the very pangs of death he cried,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like to a dismal clangour heard from far,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Warwick, revenge! brother, revenge my death!'</div>
                              <div class="line">So, underneath the belly of their steeds,</div>
                              <div class="line">That stain'd their fetlocks in his smoking blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">The noble gentleman gave up the ghost.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Then let the earth be drunken with our blood:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll kill my horse, because I will not fly.</div>
                              <div class="line">Why stand we like soft-hearted women here,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wailing our losses, whiles the foe doth rage;</div>
                              <div class="line">And look upon, as if the tragedy</div>
                              <div class="line">Were play'd in jest by counterfeiting actors?</div>
                              <div class="line">Here on my knee I vow to God above,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll never pause again, never stand still,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till either death hath closed these eyes of mine</div>
                              <div class="line">Or fortune given me measure of revenge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">O Warwick, I do bend my knee with thine;</div>
                              <div class="line">And in this vow do chain my soul to thine!</div>
                              <div class="line">And, ere my knee rise from the earth's cold face,</div>
                              <div class="line">I throw my hands, mine eyes, my heart to thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou setter up and plucker down of kings,</div>
                              <div class="line">Beseeching thee, if with they will it stands</div>
                              <div class="line">That to my foes this body must be prey,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet that thy brazen gates of heaven may ope,</div>
                              <div class="line">And give sweet passage to my sinful soul!</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, lords, take leave until we meet again,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where'er it be, in heaven or in earth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Brother, give me thy hand; and, gentle Warwick,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me embrace thee in my weary arms:</div>
                              <div class="line">I, that did never weep, now melt with woe</div>
                              <div class="line">That winter should cut off our spring-time so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Away, away! Once more, sweet lords farewell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GEORGE</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet let us all together to our troops,</div>
                              <div class="line">And give them leave to fly that will not stay;</div>
                              <div class="line">And call them pillars that will stand to us;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, if we thrive, promise them such rewards</div>
                              <div class="line">As victors wear at the Olympian games:</div>
                              <div class="line">This may plant courage in their quailing breasts;</div>
                              <div class="line">For yet is hope of life and victory.</div>
                              <div class="line">Forslow no longer, make we hence amain.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Excursions. Enter RICHARD and CLIFFORD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, Clifford, I have singled thee alone:</div>
                              <div class="line">Suppose this arm is for the Duke of York,</div>
                              <div class="line">And this for Rutland; both bound to revenge,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wert thou environ'd with a brazen wall.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLIFFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, Richard, I am with thee here alone:</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the hand that stabb'd thy father York;</div>
                              <div class="line">And this the hand that slew thy brother Rutland;</div>
                              <div class="line">And here's the heart that triumphs in their death</div>
                              <div class="line">And cheers these hands that slew thy sire and brother</div>
                              <div class="line">To execute the like upon thyself;</div>
                              <div class="line">And so, have at thee!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>They fight. WARWICK comes; CLIFFORD flies</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay Warwick, single out some other chase;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I myself will hunt this wolf to death.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE V.  Another part of the field.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Alarum. Enter KING HENRY VI alone</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">This battle fares like to the morning's war,</div>
                              <div class="line">When dying clouds contend with growing light,</div>
                              <div class="line">What time the shepherd, blowing of his nails,</div>
                              <div class="line">Can neither call it perfect day nor night.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now sways it this way, like a mighty sea</div>
                              <div class="line">Forced by the tide to combat with the wind;</div>
                              <div class="line">Now sways it that way, like the selfsame sea</div>
                              <div class="line">Forced to retire by fury of the wind:</div>
                              <div class="line">Sometime the flood prevails, and then the wind;</div>
                              <div class="line">Now one the better, then another best;</div>
                              <div class="line">Both tugging to be victors, breast to breast,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet neither conqueror nor conquered:</div>
                              <div class="line">So is the equal of this fell war.</div>
                              <div class="line">Here on this molehill will I sit me down.</div>
                              <div class="line">To whom God will, there be the victory!</div>
                              <div class="line">For Margaret my queen, and Clifford too,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have chid me from the battle; swearing both</div>
                              <div class="line">They prosper best of all when I am thence.</div>
                              <div class="line">Would I were dead! if God's good will were so;</div>
                              <div class="line">For what is in this world but grief and woe?</div>
                              <div class="line">O God! methinks it were a happy life,</div>
                              <div class="line">To be no better than a homely swain;</div>
                              <div class="line">To sit upon a hill, as I do now,</div>
                              <div class="line">To carve out dials quaintly, point by point,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thereby to see the minutes how they run,</div>
                              <div class="line">How many make the hour full complete;</div>
                              <div class="line">How many hours bring about the day;</div>
                              <div class="line">How many days will finish up the year;</div>
                              <div class="line">How many years a mortal man may live.</div>
                              <div class="line">When this is known, then to divide the times:</div>
                              <div class="line">So many hours must I tend my flock;</div>
                              <div class="line">So many hours must I take my rest;</div>
                              <div class="line">So many hours must I contemplate;</div>
                              <div class="line">So many hours must I sport myself;</div>
                              <div class="line">So many days my ewes have been with young;</div>
                              <div class="line">So many weeks ere the poor fools will ean:</div>
                              <div class="line">So many years ere I shall shear the fleece:</div>
                              <div class="line">So minutes, hours, days, months, and years,</div>
                              <div class="line">Pass'd over to the end they were created,</div>
                              <div class="line">Would bring white hairs unto a quiet grave.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, what a life were this! how sweet! how lovely!</div>
                              <div class="line">Gives not the hawthorn-bush a sweeter shade</div>
                              <div class="line">To shepherds looking on their silly sheep,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than doth a rich embroider'd canopy</div>
                              <div class="line">To kings that fear their subjects' treachery?</div>
                              <div class="line">O, yes, it doth; a thousand-fold it doth.</div>
                              <div class="line">And to conclude, the shepherd's homely curds,</div>
                              <div class="line">His cold thin drink out of his leather bottle.</div>
                              <div class="line">His wonted sleep under a fresh tree's shade,</div>
                              <div class="line">All which secure and sweetly he enjoys,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is far beyond a prince's delicates,</div>
                              <div class="line">His viands sparkling in a golden cup,</div>
                              <div class="line">His body couched in a curious bed,</div>
                              <div class="line">When care, mistrust, and treason waits on him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Alarum. Enter a Son that has killed his father,
dragging in the dead body</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Son</div>
                              <div class="line">Ill blows the wind that profits nobody.</div>
                              <div class="line">This man, whom hand to hand I slew in fight,</div>
                              <div class="line">May be possessed with some store of crowns;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I, that haply take them from him now,</div>
                              <div class="line">May yet ere night yield both my life and them</div>
                              <div class="line">To some man else, as this dead man doth me.</div>
                              <div class="line">Who's this? O God! it is my father's face,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom in this conflict I unwares have kill'd.</div>
                              <div class="line">O heavy times, begetting such events!</div>
                              <div class="line">From London by the king was I press'd forth;</div>
                              <div class="line">My father, being the Earl of Warwick's man,</div>
                              <div class="line">Came on the part of York, press'd by his master;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I, who at his hands received my life, him</div>
                              <div class="line">Have by my hands of life bereaved him.</div>
                              <div class="line">Pardon me, God, I knew not what I did!</div>
                              <div class="line">And pardon, father, for I knew not thee!</div>
                              <div class="line">My tears shall wipe away these bloody marks;</div>
                              <div class="line">And no more words till they have flow'd their fill.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">O piteous spectacle! O bloody times!</div>
                              <div class="line">Whiles lions war and battle for their dens,</div>
                              <div class="line">Poor harmless lambs abide their enmity.</div>
                              <div class="line">Weep, wretched man, I'll aid thee tear for tear;</div>
                              <div class="line">And let our hearts and eyes, like civil war,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be blind with tears, and break o'ercharged with grief.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Father that has killed his son, bringing in the body</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Father</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou that so stoutly hast resisted me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me thy gold, if thou hast any gold:</div>
                              <div class="line">For I have bought it with an hundred blows.</div>
                              <div class="line">But let me see: is this our foeman's face?</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, no, no, no, it is mine only son!</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, boy, if any life be left in thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Throw up thine eye! see, see what showers arise,</div>
                              <div class="line">Blown with the windy tempest of my heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon thy words, that kill mine eye and heart!</div>
                              <div class="line">O, pity, God, this miserable age!</div>
                              <div class="line">What stratagems, how fell, how butcherly,</div>
                              <div class="line">Erroneous, mutinous and unnatural,</div>
                              <div class="line">This deadly quarrel daily doth beget!</div>
                              <div class="line">O boy, thy father gave thee life too soon,</div>
                              <div class="line">And hath bereft thee of thy life too late!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Woe above woe! grief more than common grief!</div>
                              <div class="line">O that my death would stay these ruthful deeds!</div>
                              <div class="line">O pity, pity, gentle heaven, pity!</div>
                              <div class="line">The red rose and the white are on his face,</div>
                              <div class="line">The fatal colours of our striving houses:</div>
                              <div class="line">The one his purple blood right well resembles;</div>
                              <div class="line">The other his pale cheeks, methinks, presenteth:</div>
                              <div class="line">Wither one rose, and let the other flourish;</div>
                              <div class="line">If you contend, a thousand lives must wither.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Son</div>
                              <div class="line">How will my mother for a father's death</div>
                              <div class="line">Take on with me and ne'er be satisfied!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Father</div>
                              <div class="line">How will my wife for slaughter of my son</div>
                              <div class="line">Shed seas of tears and ne'er be satisfied!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">How will the country for these woful chances</div>
                              <div class="line">Misthink the king and not be satisfied!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Son</div>
                              <div class="line">Was ever son so rued a father's death?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Father</div>
                              <div class="line">Was ever father so bemoan'd his son?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Was ever king so grieved for subjects' woe?</div>
                              <div class="line">Much is your sorrow; mine ten times so much.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Son</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll bear thee hence, where I may weep my fill.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit with the body</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Father</div>
                              <div class="line">These arms of mine shall be thy winding-sheet;</div>
                              <div class="line">My heart, sweet boy, shall be thy sepulchre,</div>
                              <div class="line">For from my heart thine image ne'er shall go;</div>
                              <div class="line">My sighing breast shall be thy funeral bell;</div>
                              <div class="line">And so obsequious will thy father be,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even for the loss of thee, having no more,</div>
                              <div class="line">As Priam was for all his valiant sons.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll bear thee hence; and let them fight that will,</div>
                              <div class="line">For I have murdered where I should not kill.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit with the body</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Sad-hearted men, much overgone with care,</div>
                              <div class="line">Here sits a king more woful than you are.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Alarums: excursions. Enter QUEEN MARGARET, PRINCE
EDWARD, and EXETER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Fly, father, fly! for all your friends are fled,</div>
                              <div class="line">And Warwick rages like a chafed bull:</div>
                              <div class="line">Away! for death doth hold us in pursuit.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
