                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, say, fair queen, whence springs this deep despair?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">From such a cause as fills mine eyes with tears</div>
                              <div class="line">And stops my tongue, while heart is drown'd in cares.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">Whate'er it be, be thou still like thyself,</div>
                              <div class="line">And sit thee by our side:</div>
                              <p>Seats her by him</p>
                              <div class="line">Yield not thy neck</div>
                              <div class="line">To fortune's yoke, but let thy dauntless mind</div>
                              <div class="line">Still ride in triumph over all mischance.</div>
                              <div class="line">Be plain, Queen Margaret, and tell thy grief;</div>
                              <div class="line">It shall be eased, if France can yield relief.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Those gracious words revive my drooping thoughts</div>
                              <div class="line">And give my tongue-tied sorrows leave to speak.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, therefore, be it known to noble Lewis,</div>
                              <div class="line">That Henry, sole possessor of my love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is of a king become a banish'd man,</div>
                              <div class="line">And forced to live in Scotland a forlorn;</div>
                              <div class="line">While proud ambitious Edward Duke of York</div>
                              <div class="line">Usurps the regal title and the seat</div>
                              <div class="line">Of England's true-anointed lawful king.</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the cause that I, poor Margaret,</div>
                              <div class="line">With this my son, Prince Edward, Henry's heir,</div>
                              <div class="line">Am come to crave thy just and lawful aid;</div>
                              <div class="line">And if thou fail us, all our hope is done:</div>
                              <div class="line">Scotland hath will to help, but cannot help;</div>
                              <div class="line">Our people and our peers are both misled,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our treasures seized, our soldiers put to flight,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, as thou seest, ourselves in heavy plight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">Renowned queen, with patience calm the storm,</div>
                              <div class="line">While we bethink a means to break it off.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">The more we stay, the stronger grows our foe.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">The more I stay, the more I'll succor thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">O, but impatience waiteth on true sorrow.</div>
                              <div class="line">And see where comes the breeder of my sorrow!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter WARWICK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">What's he approacheth boldly to our presence?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Our Earl of Warwick, Edward's greatest friend.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">Welcome, brave Warwick! What brings thee to France?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>He descends. She ariseth</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, now begins a second storm to rise;</div>
                              <div class="line">For this is he that moves both wind and tide.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">From worthy Edward, King of Albion,</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord and sovereign, and thy vowed friend,</div>
                              <div class="line">I come, in kindness and unfeigned love,</div>
                              <div class="line">First, to do greetings to thy royal person;</div>
                              <div class="line">And then to crave a league of amity;</div>
                              <div class="line">And lastly, to confirm that amity</div>
                              <div class="line">With a nuptial knot, if thou vouchsafe to grant</div>
                              <div class="line">That virtuous Lady Bona, thy fair sister,</div>
                              <div class="line">To England's king in lawful marriage.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  If that go forward, Henry's hope is done.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To BONA</span>  And, gracious madam, in our king's behalf,</div>
                              <div class="line">I am commanded, with your leave and favour,</div>
                              <div class="line">Humbly to kiss your hand, and with my tongue</div>
                              <div class="line">To tell the passion of my sovereign's heart;</div>
                              <div class="line">Where fame, late entering at his heedful ears,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath placed thy beauty's image and thy virtue.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">King Lewis and Lady Bona, hear me speak,</div>
                              <div class="line">Before you answer Warwick. His demand</div>
                              <div class="line">Springs not from Edward's well-meant honest love,</div>
                              <div class="line">But from deceit bred by necessity;</div>
                              <div class="line">For how can tyrants safely govern home,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless abroad they purchase great alliance?</div>
                              <div class="line">To prove him tyrant this reason may suffice,</div>
                              <div class="line">That Henry liveth still: but were he dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet here Prince Edward stands, King Henry's son.</div>
                              <div class="line">Look, therefore, Lewis, that by this league and marriage</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou draw not on thy danger and dishonour;</div>
                              <div class="line">For though usurpers sway the rule awhile,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet heavens are just, and time suppresseth wrongs.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Injurious Margaret!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">And why not queen?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Because thy father Henry did usurp;</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou no more are prince than she is queen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OXFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Then Warwick disannuls great John of Gaunt,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which did subdue the greatest part of Spain;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, after John of Gaunt, Henry the Fourth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose wisdom was a mirror to the wisest;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, after that wise prince, Henry the Fifth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who by his prowess conquered all France:</div>
                              <div class="line">From these our Henry lineally descends.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Oxford, how haps it, in this smooth discourse,</div>
                              <div class="line">You told not how Henry the Sixth hath lost</div>
                              <div class="line">All that which Henry Fifth had gotten?</div>
                              <div class="line">Methinks these peers of France should smile at that.</div>
                              <div class="line">But for the rest, you tell a pedigree</div>
                              <div class="line">Of threescore and two years; a silly time</div>
                              <div class="line">To make prescription for a kingdom's worth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OXFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, Warwick, canst thou speak against thy liege,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom thou obeyed'st thirty and six years,</div>
                              <div class="line">And not bewray thy treason with a blush?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Can Oxford, that did ever fence the right,</div>
                              <div class="line">Now buckler falsehood with a pedigree?</div>
                              <div class="line">For shame! leave Henry, and call Edward king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OXFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Call him my king by whose injurious doom</div>
                              <div class="line">My elder brother, the Lord Aubrey Vere,</div>
                              <div class="line">Was done to death? and more than so, my father,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even in the downfall of his mellow'd years,</div>
                              <div class="line">When nature brought him to the door of death?</div>
                              <div class="line">No, Warwick, no; while life upholds this arm,</div>
                              <div class="line">This arm upholds the house of Lancaster.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">And I the house of York.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">Queen Margaret, Prince Edward, and Oxford,</div>
                              <div class="line">Vouchsafe, at our request, to stand aside,</div>
                              <div class="line">While I use further conference with Warwick.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>They stand aloof</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Heavens grant that Warwick's words bewitch him not!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">Now Warwick, tell me, even upon thy conscience,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is Edward your true king? for I were loath</div>
                              <div class="line">To link with him that were not lawful chosen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Thereon I pawn my credit and mine honour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">But is he gracious in the people's eye?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">The more that Henry was unfortunate.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">Then further, all dissembling set aside,</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell me for truth the measure of his love</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto our sister Bona.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Such it seems</div>
                              <div class="line">As may beseem a monarch like himself.</div>
                              <div class="line">Myself have often heard him say and swear</div>
                              <div class="line">That this his love was an eternal plant,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whereof the root was fix'd in virtue's ground,</div>
                              <div class="line">The leaves and fruit maintain'd with beauty's sun,</div>
                              <div class="line">Exempt from envy, but not from disdain,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless the Lady Bona quit his pain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, sister, let us hear your firm resolve.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BONA</div>
                              <div class="line">Your grant, or your denial, shall be mine:</div>
                              <p>To WARWICK</p>
                              <div class="line">Yet I confess that often ere this day,</div>
                              <div class="line">When I have heard your king's desert recounted,</div>
                              <div class="line">Mine ear hath tempted judgment to desire.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, Warwick, thus: our sister shall be Edward's;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now forthwith shall articles be drawn</div>
                              <div class="line">Touching the jointure that your king must make,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which with her dowry shall be counterpoised.</div>
                              <div class="line">Draw near, Queen Margaret, and be a witness</div>
                              <div class="line">That Bona shall be wife to the English king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">To Edward, but not to the English king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Deceitful Warwick! it was thy device</div>
                              <div class="line">By this alliance to make void my suit:</div>
                              <div class="line">Before thy coming Lewis was Henry's friend.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">And still is friend to him and Margaret:</div>
                              <div class="line">But if your title to the crown be weak,</div>
                              <div class="line">As may appear by Edward's good success,</div>
                              <div class="line">Then 'tis but reason that I be released</div>
                              <div class="line">From giving aid which late I promised.</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet shall you have all kindness at my hand</div>
                              <div class="line">That your estate requires and mine can yield.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Henry now lives in Scotland at his ease,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where having nothing, nothing can he lose.</div>
                              <div class="line">And as for you yourself, our quondam queen,</div>
                              <div class="line">You have a father able to maintain you;</div>
                              <div class="line">And better 'twere you troubled him than France.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, impudent and shameless Warwick, peace,</div>
                              <div class="line">Proud setter up and puller down of kings!</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not hence, till, with my talk and tears,</div>
                              <div class="line">Both full of truth, I make King Lewis behold</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy sly conveyance and thy lord's false love;</div>
                              <div class="line">For both of you are birds of selfsame feather.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Post blows a horn within</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">Warwick, this is some post to us or thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Post</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Post</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To WARWICK</span>  My lord ambassador, these letters are for you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sent from your brother, Marquess Montague:</div>
                              <p>To KING LEWIS XI</p>
                              <div class="line">These from our king unto your majesty:</div>
                              <p>To QUEEN MARGARET</p>
                              <div class="line">And, madam, these for you; from whom I know not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>They all read their letters</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OXFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">I like it well that our fair queen and mistress</div>
                              <div class="line">Smiles at her news, while Warwick frowns at his.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, mark how Lewis stamps, as he were nettled:</div>
                              <div class="line">I hope all's for the best.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">Warwick, what are thy news? and yours, fair queen?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Mine, such as fill my heart with unhoped joys.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Mine, full of sorrow and heart's discontent.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">What! has your king married the Lady Grey!</div>
                              <div class="line">And now, to soothe your forgery and his,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sends me a paper to persuade me patience?</div>
                              <div class="line">Is this the alliance that he seeks with France?</div>
                              <div class="line">Dare he presume to scorn us in this manner?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">I told your majesty as much before:</div>
                              <div class="line">This proveth Edward's love and Warwick's honesty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">King Lewis, I here protest, in sight of heaven,</div>
                              <div class="line">And by the hope I have of heavenly bliss,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I am clear from this misdeed of Edward's,</div>
                              <div class="line">No more my king, for he dishonours me,</div>
                              <div class="line">But most himself, if he could see his shame.</div>
                              <div class="line">Did I forget that by the house of York</div>
                              <div class="line">My father came untimely to his death?</div>
                              <div class="line">Did I let pass the abuse done to my niece?</div>
                              <div class="line">Did I impale him with the regal crown?</div>
                              <div class="line">Did I put Henry from his native right?</div>
                              <div class="line">And am I guerdon'd at the last with shame?</div>
                              <div class="line">Shame on himself! for my desert is honour:</div>
                              <div class="line">And to repair my honour lost for him,</div>
                              <div class="line">I here renounce him and return to Henry.</div>
                              <div class="line">My noble queen, let former grudges pass,</div>
                              <div class="line">And henceforth I am thy true servitor:</div>
                              <div class="line">I will revenge his wrong to Lady Bona,</div>
                              <div class="line">And replant Henry in his former state.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Warwick, these words have turn'd my hate to love;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I forgive and quite forget old faults,</div>
                              <div class="line">And joy that thou becomest King Henry's friend.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">So much his friend, ay, his unfeigned friend,</div>
                              <div class="line">That, if King Lewis vouchsafe to furnish us</div>
                              <div class="line">With some few bands of chosen soldiers,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll undertake to land them on our coast</div>
                              <div class="line">And force the tyrant from his seat by war.</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis not his new-made bride shall succor him:</div>
                              <div class="line">And as for Clarence, as my letters tell me,</div>
                              <div class="line">He's very likely now to fall from him,</div>
                              <div class="line">For matching more for wanton lust than honour,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or than for strength and safety of our country.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BONA</div>
                              <div class="line">Dear brother, how shall Bona be revenged</div>
                              <div class="line">But by thy help to this distressed queen?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Renowned prince, how shall poor Henry live,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless thou rescue him from foul despair?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BONA</div>
                              <div class="line">My quarrel and this English queen's are one.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">And mine, fair lady Bona, joins with yours.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">And mine with hers, and thine, and Margaret's.</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore at last I firmly am resolved</div>
                              <div class="line">You shall have aid.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me give humble thanks for all at once.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, England's messenger, return in post,</div>
                              <div class="line">And tell false Edward, thy supposed king,</div>
                              <div class="line">That Lewis of France is sending over masquers</div>
                              <div class="line">To revel it with him and his new bride:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou seest what's past, go fear thy king withal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BONA</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell him, in hope he'll prove a widower shortly,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll wear the willow garland for his sake.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell him, my mourning weeds are laid aside,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I am ready to put armour on.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell him from me that he hath done me wrong,</div>
                              <div class="line">And therefore I'll uncrown him ere't be long.</div>
                              <div class="line">There's thy reward: be gone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit Post</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">But, Warwick,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou and Oxford, with five thousand men,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall cross the seas, and bid false Edward battle;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, as occasion serves, this noble queen</div>
                              <div class="line">And prince shall follow with a fresh supply.</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, ere thou go, but answer me one doubt,</div>
                              <div class="line">What pledge have we of thy firm loyalty?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">This shall assure my constant loyalty,</div>
                              <div class="line">That if our queen and this young prince agree,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll join mine eldest daughter and my joy</div>
                              <div class="line">To him forthwith in holy wedlock bands.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, I agree, and thank you for your motion.</div>
                              <div class="line">Son Edward, she is fair and virtuous,</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore delay not, give thy hand to Warwick;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, with thy hand, thy faith irrevocable,</div>
                              <div class="line">That only Warwick's daughter shall be thine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, I accept her, for she well deserves it;</div>
                              <div class="line">And here, to pledge my vow, I give my hand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>He gives his hand to WARWICK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING LEWIS XI</div>
                              <div class="line">Why stay we now? These soldiers shall be levied,</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou, Lord Bourbon, our high admiral,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shalt waft them over with our royal fleet.</div>
                              <div class="line">I long till Edward fall by war's mischance,</div>
                              <div class="line">For mocking marriage with a dame of France.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but WARWICK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">I came from Edward as ambassador,</div>
                              <div class="line">But I return his sworn and mortal foe:</div>
                              <div class="line">Matter of marriage was the charge he gave me,</div>
                              <div class="line">But dreadful war shall answer his demand.</div>
                              <div class="line">Had he none else to make a stale but me?</div>
                              <div class="line">Then none but I shall turn his jest to sorrow.</div>
                              <div class="line">I was the chief that raised him to the crown,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I'll be chief to bring him down again:</div>
                              <div class="line">Not that I pity Henry's misery,</div>
                              <div class="line">But seek revenge on Edward's mockery.</div>
                              <p>Exit</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  London. The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.5">4. SCENE IV.  London. The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.6">5. SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.7">6. SCENE VI.  London. The Tower.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.8">7. SCENE VII.  Before York.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.9">8. SCENE VIII.  London. The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  London. The palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER, CLARENCE, SOMERSET, and MONTAGUE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Now tell me, brother Clarence, what think you</div>
                              <div class="line">Of this new marriage with the Lady Grey?</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath not our brother made a worthy choice?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, you know, 'tis far from hence to France;</div>
                              <div class="line">How could he stay till Warwick made return?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">My lords, forbear this talk; here comes the king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">And his well-chosen bride.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">I mind to tell him plainly what I think.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Flourish. Enter KING EDWARD IV, attended; QUEEN
ELIZABETH, PEMBROKE, STAFFORD, HASTINGS, and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, brother of Clarence, how like you our choice,</div>
                              <div class="line">That you stand pensive, as half malcontent?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">As well as Lewis of France, or the Earl of Warwick,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which are so weak of courage and in judgment</div>
                              <div class="line">That they'll take no offence at our abuse.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Suppose they take offence without a cause,</div>
                              <div class="line">They are but Lewis and Warwick: I am Edward,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your king and Warwick's, and must have my will.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">And shall have your will, because our king:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet hasty marriage seldom proveth well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, brother Richard, are you offended too?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Not I:</div>
                              <div class="line">No, God forbid that I should wish them sever'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom God hath join'd together; ay, and 'twere pity</div>
                              <div class="line">To sunder them that yoke so well together.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Setting your scorns and your mislike aside,</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell me some reason why the Lady Grey</div>
                              <div class="line">Should not become my wife and England's queen.</div>
                              <div class="line">And you too, Somerset and Montague,</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak freely what you think.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Then this is mine opinion: that King Lewis</div>
                              <div class="line">Becomes your enemy, for mocking him</div>
                              <div class="line">About the marriage of the Lady Bona.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">And Warwick, doing what you gave in charge,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is now dishonoured by this new marriage.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">What if both Lewis and Warwick be appeased</div>
                              <div class="line">By such invention as I can devise?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, to have join'd with France in such alliance</div>
                              <div class="line">Would more have strengthen'd this our commonwealth</div>
                              <div class="line">'Gainst foreign storms than any home-bred marriage.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, knows not Montague that of itself</div>
                              <div class="line">England is safe, if true within itself?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">But the safer when 'tis back'd with France.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis better using France than trusting France:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let us be back'd with God and with the seas</div>
                              <div class="line">Which He hath given for fence impregnable,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with their helps only defend ourselves;</div>
                              <div class="line">In them and in ourselves our safety lies.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">For this one speech Lord Hastings well deserves</div>
                              <div class="line">To have the heir of the Lord Hungerford.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, what of that? it was my will and grant;</div>
                              <div class="line">And for this once my will shall stand for law.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet methinks your grace hath not done well,</div>
                              <div class="line">To give the heir and daughter of Lord Scales</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto the brother of your loving bride;</div>
                              <div class="line">She better would have fitted me or Clarence:</div>
                              <div class="line">But in your bride you bury brotherhood.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Or else you would not have bestow'd the heir</div>
                              <div class="line">Of the Lord Bonville on your new wife's son,</div>
                              <div class="line">And leave your brothers to go speed elsewhere.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, poor Clarence! is it for a wife</div>
                              <div class="line">That thou art malcontent? I will provide thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">In choosing for yourself, you show'd your judgment,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which being shallow, you give me leave</div>
                              <div class="line">To play the broker in mine own behalf;</div>
                              <div class="line">And to that end I shortly mind to leave you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Leave me, or tarry, Edward will be king,</div>
                              <div class="line">And not be tied unto his brother's will.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">My lords, before it pleased his majesty</div>
                              <div class="line">To raise my state to title of a queen,</div>
                              <div class="line">Do me but right, and you must all confess</div>
                              <div class="line">That I was not ignoble of descent;</div>
                              <div class="line">And meaner than myself have had like fortune.</div>
                              <div class="line">But as this title honours me and mine,</div>
                              <div class="line">So your dislike, to whom I would be pleasing,</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth cloud my joys with danger and with sorrow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">My love, forbear to fawn upon their frowns:</div>
                              <div class="line">What danger or what sorrow can befall thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">So long as Edward is thy constant friend,</div>
                              <div class="line">And their true sovereign, whom they must obey?</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, whom they shall obey, and love thee too,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless they seek for hatred at my hands;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which if they do, yet will I keep thee safe,</div>
                              <div class="line">And they shall feel the vengeance of my wrath.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  I hear, yet say not much, but think the more.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Post</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, messenger, what letters or what news</div>
                              <div class="line">From France?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Post</div>
                              <div class="line">My sovereign liege, no letters; and few words,</div>
                              <div class="line">But such as I, without your special pardon,</div>
                              <div class="line">Dare not relate.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Go to, we pardon thee: therefore, in brief,</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell me their words as near as thou canst guess them.</div>
                              <div class="line">What answer makes King Lewis unto our letters?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Post</div>
                              <div class="line">At my depart, these were his very words:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Go tell false Edward, thy supposed king,</div>
                              <div class="line">That Lewis of France is sending over masquers</div>
                              <div class="line">To revel it with him and his new bride.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Is Lewis so brave? belike he thinks me Henry.</div>
                              <div class="line">But what said Lady Bona to my marriage?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Post</div>
                              <div class="line">These were her words, utter'd with mad disdain:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tell him, in hope he'll prove a widower shortly,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll wear the willow garland for his sake.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">I blame not her, she could say little less;</div>
                              <div class="line">She had the wrong. But what said Henry's queen?</div>
                              <div class="line">For I have heard that she was there in place.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Post</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tell him,' quoth she, 'my mourning weeds are done,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I am ready to put armour on.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Belike she minds to play the Amazon.</div>
                              <div class="line">But what said Warwick to these injuries?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Post</div>
                              <div class="line">He, more incensed against your majesty</div>
                              <div class="line">Than all the rest, discharged me with these words:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tell him from me that he hath done me wrong,</div>
                              <div class="line">And therefore I'll uncrown him ere't be long.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Ha! durst the traitor breathe out so proud words?</div>
                              <div class="line">Well I will arm me, being thus forewarn'd:</div>
                              <div class="line">They shall have wars and pay for their presumption.</div>
                              <div class="line">But say, is Warwick friends with Margaret?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Post</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, gracious sovereign; they are so link'd in</div>
                              <div class="line">friendship</div>
                              <div class="line">That young Prince Edward marries Warwick's daughter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Belike the elder; Clarence will have the younger.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, brother king, farewell, and sit you fast,</div>
                              <div class="line">For I will hence to Warwick's other daughter;</div>
                              <div class="line">That, though I want a kingdom, yet in marriage</div>
                              <div class="line">I may not prove inferior to yourself.</div>
                              <div class="line">You that love me and Warwick, follow me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit CLARENCE, and SOMERSET follows</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  Not I:</div>
                              <div class="line">My thoughts aim at a further matter; I</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay not for the love of Edward, but the crown.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Clarence and Somerset both gone to Warwick!</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet am I arm'd against the worst can happen;</div>
                              <div class="line">And haste is needful in this desperate case.</div>
                              <div class="line">Pembroke and Stafford, you in our behalf</div>
                              <div class="line">Go levy men, and make prepare for war;</div>
                              <div class="line">They are already, or quickly will be landed:</div>
                              <div class="line">Myself in person will straight follow you.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt PEMBROKE and STAFFORD</p>
                              <div class="line">But, ere I go, Hastings and Montague,</div>
                              <div class="line">Resolve my doubt. You twain, of all the rest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Are near to Warwick by blood and by alliance:</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell me if you love Warwick more than me?</div>
                              <div class="line">If it be so, then both depart to him;</div>
                              <div class="line">I rather wish you foes than hollow friends:</div>
                              <div class="line">But if you mind to hold your true obedience,</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me assurance with some friendly vow,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I may never have you in suspect.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">So God help Montague as he proves true!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">And Hastings as he favours Edward's cause!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, brother Richard, will you stand by us?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, in despite of all that shall withstand you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, so! then am I sure of victory.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now therefore let us hence; and lose no hour,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till we meet Warwick with his foreign power.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter WARWICK and OXFORD, with French soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Trust me, my lord, all hitherto goes well;</div>
                              <div class="line">The common people by numbers swarm to us.</div>
                              <p>Enter CLARENCE and SOMERSET</p>
                              <div class="line">But see where Somerset and Clarence come!</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak suddenly, my lords, are we all friends?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Fear not that, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, gentle Clarence, welcome unto Warwick;</div>
                              <div class="line">And welcome, Somerset: I hold it cowardice</div>
                              <div class="line">To rest mistrustful where a noble heart</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath pawn'd an open hand in sign of love;</div>
                              <div class="line">Else might I think that Clarence, Edward's brother,</div>
                              <div class="line">Were but a feigned friend to our proceedings:</div>
                              <div class="line">But welcome, sweet Clarence; my daughter shall be thine.</div>
                              <div class="line">And now what rests but, in night's coverture,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy brother being carelessly encamp'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">His soldiers lurking in the towns about,</div>
                              <div class="line">And but attended by a simple guard,</div>
                              <div class="line">We may surprise and take him at our pleasure?</div>
                              <div class="line">Our scouts have found the adventure very easy:</div>
                              <div class="line">That as Ulysses and stout Diomede</div>
                              <div class="line">With sleight and manhood stole to Rhesus' tents,</div>
                              <div class="line">And brought from thence the Thracian fatal steeds,</div>
                              <div class="line">So we, well cover'd with the night's black mantle,</div>
                              <div class="line">At unawares may beat down Edward's guard</div>
                              <div class="line">And seize himself; I say not, slaughter him,</div>
                              <div class="line">For I intend but only to surprise him.</div>
                              <div class="line">You that will follow me to this attempt,</div>
                              <div class="line">Applaud the name of Henry with your leader.</div>
                              <p>They all cry, 'Henry!'</p>
                              <div class="line">Why, then, let's on our way in silent sort:</div>
                              <div class="line">For Warwick and his friends, God and Saint George!</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter three Watchmen, to guard KING EDWARD IV's tent</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">Come on, my masters, each man take his stand:</div>
                              <div class="line">The king by this is set him down to sleep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">What, will he not to bed?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, no; for he hath made a solemn vow</div>
                              <div class="line">Never to lie and take his natural rest</div>
                              <div class="line">Till Warwick or himself be quite suppress'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">To-morrow then belike shall be the day,</div>
                              <div class="line">If Warwick be so near as men report.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">But say, I pray, what nobleman is that</div>
                              <div class="line">That with the king here resteth in his tent?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis the Lord Hastings, the king's chiefest friend.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">O, is it so? But why commands the king</div>
                              <div class="line">That his chief followers lodge in towns about him,</div>
                              <div class="line">While he himself keeps in the cold field?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis the more honour, because more dangerous.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, but give me worship and quietness;</div>
                              <div class="line">I like it better than a dangerous honour.</div>
                              <div class="line">If Warwick knew in what estate he stands,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis to be doubted he would waken him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless our halberds did shut up his passage.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, wherefore else guard we his royal tent,</div>
                              <div class="line">But to defend his person from night-foes?</div>
