                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter WARWICK, CLARENCE, OXFORD, SOMERSET, and
French soldiers, silent all</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">This is his tent; and see where stand his guard.</div>
                              <div class="line">Courage, my masters! honour now or never!</div>
                              <div class="line">But follow me, and Edward shall be ours.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">Who goes there?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay, or thou diest!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>WARWICK and the rest cry all, 'Warwick! Warwick!'
and set upon the Guard, who fly, crying, 'Arm!
arm!' WARWICK and the rest following them</p>
                        <p>The drum playing and trumpet sounding, reenter
WARWICK, SOMERSET, and the rest, bringing KING
EDWARD IV out in his gown, sitting in a chair.
RICHARD and HASTINGS fly over the stage</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">What are they that fly there?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Richard and Hastings: let them go; here is The duke.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">The duke! Why, Warwick, when we parted,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou call'dst me king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, but the case is alter'd:</div>
                              <div class="line">When you disgraced me in my embassade,</div>
                              <div class="line">Then I degraded you from being king,</div>
                              <div class="line">And come now to create you Duke of York.</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas! how should you govern any kingdom,</div>
                              <div class="line">That know not how to use ambassadors,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor how to be contented with one wife,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor how to use your brothers brotherly,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor how to study for the people's welfare,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor how to shroud yourself from enemies?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, brother of Clarence, are thou here too?</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, then I see that Edward needs must down.</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, Warwick, in despite of all mischance,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of thee thyself and all thy complices,</div>
                              <div class="line">Edward will always bear himself as king:</div>
                              <div class="line">Though fortune's malice overthrow my state,</div>
                              <div class="line">My mind exceeds the compass of her wheel.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, for his mind, be Edward England's king:</div>
                              <p>Takes off his crown</p>
                              <div class="line">But Henry now shall wear the English crown,</div>
                              <div class="line">And be true king indeed, thou but the shadow.</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of Somerset, at my request,</div>
                              <div class="line">See that forthwith Duke Edward be convey'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto my brother, Archbishop of York.</div>
                              <div class="line">When I have fought with Pembroke and his fellows,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll follow you, and tell what answer</div>
                              <div class="line">Lewis and the Lady Bona send to him.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, for a while farewell, good Duke of York.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>They lead him out forcibly</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">What fates impose, that men must needs abide;</div>
                              <div class="line">It boots not to resist both wind and tide.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit, guarded</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OXFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">What now remains, my lords, for us to do</div>
                              <div class="line">But march to London with our soldiers?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, that's the first thing that we have to do;</div>
                              <div class="line">To free King Henry from imprisonment</div>
                              <div class="line">And see him seated in the regal throne.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  London. The palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter QUEEN ELIZABETH and RIVERS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, what makes you in this sudden change?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">Why brother Rivers, are you yet to learn</div>
                              <div class="line">What late misfortune is befall'n King Edward?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">What! loss of some pitch'd battle against Warwick?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">No, but the loss of his own royal person.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">Then is my sovereign slain?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, almost slain, for he is taken prisoner,</div>
                              <div class="line">Either betray'd by falsehood of his guard</div>
                              <div class="line">Or by his foe surprised at unawares:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, as I further have to understand,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is new committed to the Bishop of York,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fell Warwick's brother and by that our foe.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">These news I must confess are full of grief;</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, gracious madam, bear it as you may:</div>
                              <div class="line">Warwick may lose, that now hath won the day.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">Till then fair hope must hinder life's decay.</div>
                              <div class="line">And I the rather wean me from despair</div>
                              <div class="line">For love of Edward's offspring in my womb:</div>
                              <div class="line">This is it that makes me bridle passion</div>
                              <div class="line">And bear with mildness my misfortune's cross;</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, ay, for this I draw in many a tear</div>
                              <div class="line">And stop the rising of blood-sucking sighs,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest with my sighs or tears I blast or drown</div>
                              <div class="line">King Edward's fruit, true heir to the English crown.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">But, madam, where is Warwick then become?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">I am inform'd that he comes towards London,</div>
                              <div class="line">To set the crown once more on Henry's head:</div>
                              <div class="line">Guess thou the rest; King Edward's friends must down,</div>
                              <div class="line">But, to prevent the tyrant's violence,--</div>
                              <div class="line">For trust not him that hath once broken faith,--</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll hence forthwith unto the sanctuary,</div>
                              <div class="line">To save at least the heir of Edward's right:</div>
                              <div class="line">There shall I rest secure from force and fraud.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, therefore, let us fly while we may fly:</div>
                              <div class="line">If Warwick take us we are sure to die.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER, HASTINGS, and STANLEY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, my Lord Hastings and Sir William Stanley,</div>
                              <div class="line">Leave off to wonder why I drew you hither,</div>
                              <div class="line">Into this chiefest thicket of the park.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus stands the case: you know our king, my brother,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is prisoner to the bishop here, at whose hands</div>
                              <div class="line">He hath good usage and great liberty,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, often but attended with weak guard,</div>
                              <div class="line">Comes hunting this way to disport himself.</div>
                              <div class="line">I have advertised him by secret means</div>
                              <div class="line">That if about this hour he make his way</div>
                              <div class="line">Under the colour of his usual game,</div>
                              <div class="line">He shall here find his friends with horse and men</div>
                              <div class="line">To set him free from his captivity.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter KING EDWARD IV and a Huntsman with him</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Huntsman</div>
                              <div class="line">This way, my lord; for this way lies the game.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, this way, man: see where the huntsmen stand.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, brother of Gloucester, Lord Hastings, and the rest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Stand you thus close, to steal the bishop's deer?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Brother, the time and case requireth haste:</div>
                              <div class="line">Your horse stands ready at the park-corner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">But whither shall we then?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">To Lynn, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">And ship from thence to Flanders.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Well guess'd, believe me; for that was my meaning.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Stanley, I will requite thy forwardness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">But wherefore stay we? 'tis no time to talk.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Huntsman, what say'st thou? wilt thou go along?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Huntsman</div>
                              <div class="line">Better do so than tarry and be hang'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Come then, away; let's ha' no more ado.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Bishop, farewell: shield thee from Warwick's frown;</div>
                              <div class="line">And pray that I may repossess the crown.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.7">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>6. SCENE VI.  London. The Tower.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Flourish. Enter KING HENRY VI, CLARENCE, WARWICK,
SOMERSET, HENRY OF RICHMOND, OXFORD, MONTAGUE, and
Lieutenant of the Tower</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Master lieutenant, now that God and friends</div>
                              <div class="line">Have shaken Edward from the regal seat,</div>
                              <div class="line">And turn'd my captive state to liberty,</div>
                              <div class="line">My fear to hope, my sorrows unto joys,</div>
                              <div class="line">At our enlargement what are thy due fees?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lieutenant</div>
                              <div class="line">Subjects may challenge nothing of their sovereigns;</div>
                              <div class="line">But if an humble prayer may prevail,</div>
                              <div class="line">I then crave pardon of your majesty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">For what, lieutenant? for well using me?</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, be thou sure I'll well requite thy kindness,</div>
                              <div class="line">For that it made my imprisonment a pleasure;</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, such a pleasure as incaged birds</div>
                              <div class="line">Conceive when after many moody thoughts</div>
                              <div class="line">At last by notes of household harmony</div>
                              <div class="line">They quite forget their loss of liberty.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, Warwick, after God, thou set'st me free,</div>
                              <div class="line">And chiefly therefore I thank God and thee;</div>
                              <div class="line">He was the author, thou the instrument.</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, that I may conquer fortune's spite</div>
                              <div class="line">By living low, where fortune cannot hurt me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And that the people of this blessed land</div>
                              <div class="line">May not be punish'd with my thwarting stars,</div>
                              <div class="line">Warwick, although my head still wear the crown,</div>
                              <div class="line">I here resign my government to thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">For thou art fortunate in all thy deeds.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Your grace hath still been famed for virtuous;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now may seem as wise as virtuous,</div>
                              <div class="line">By spying and avoiding fortune's malice,</div>
                              <div class="line">For few men rightly temper with the stars:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet in this one thing let me blame your grace,</div>
                              <div class="line">For choosing me when Clarence is in place.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">No, Warwick, thou art worthy of the sway,</div>
                              <div class="line">To whom the heavens in thy nativity</div>
                              <div class="line">Adjudged an olive branch and laurel crown,</div>
                              <div class="line">As likely to be blest in peace and war;</div>
                              <div class="line">And therefore I yield thee my free consent.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">And I choose Clarence only for protector.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Warwick and Clarence give me both your hands:</div>
                              <div class="line">Now join your hands, and with your hands your hearts,</div>
                              <div class="line">That no dissension hinder government:</div>
                              <div class="line">I make you both protectors of this land,</div>
                              <div class="line">While I myself will lead a private life</div>
                              <div class="line">And in devotion spend my latter days,</div>
                              <div class="line">To sin's rebuke and my Creator's praise.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">What answers Clarence to his sovereign's will?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">That he consents, if Warwick yield consent;</div>
                              <div class="line">For on thy fortune I repose myself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then, though loath, yet must I be content:</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll yoke together, like a double shadow</div>
                              <div class="line">To Henry's body, and supply his place;</div>
                              <div class="line">I mean, in bearing weight of government,</div>
                              <div class="line">While he enjoys the honour and his ease.</div>
                              <div class="line">And, Clarence, now then it is more than needful</div>
                              <div class="line">Forthwith that Edward be pronounced a traitor,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all his lands and goods be confiscate.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">What else? and that succession be determined.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, therein Clarence shall not want his part.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">But, with the first of all your chief affairs,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me entreat, for I command no more,</div>
                              <div class="line">That Margaret your queen and my son Edward</div>
                              <div class="line">Be sent for, to return from France with speed;</div>
                              <div class="line">For, till I see them here, by doubtful fear</div>
                              <div class="line">My joy of liberty is half eclipsed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">It shall be done, my sovereign, with all speed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of Somerset, what youth is that,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of whom you seem to have so tender care?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">My liege, it is young Henry, earl of Richmond.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Come hither, England's hope.</div>
                              <p>Lays his hand on his head</p>
                              <div class="line">If secret powers</div>
                              <div class="line">Suggest but truth to my divining thoughts,</div>
                              <div class="line">This pretty lad will prove our country's bliss.</div>
                              <div class="line">His looks are full of peaceful majesty,</div>
                              <div class="line">His head by nature framed to wear a crown,</div>
                              <div class="line">His hand to wield a sceptre, and himself</div>
                              <div class="line">Likely in time to bless a regal throne.</div>
                              <div class="line">Make much of him, my lords, for this is he</div>
                              <div class="line">Must help you more than you are hurt by me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Post</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">What news, my friend?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Post</div>
                              <div class="line">That Edward is escaped from your brother,</div>
                              <div class="line">And fled, as he hears since, to Burgundy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Unsavoury news! but how made he escape?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Post</div>
                              <div class="line">He was convey'd by Richard Duke of Gloucester</div>
                              <div class="line">And the Lord Hastings, who attended him</div>
                              <div class="line">In secret ambush on the forest side</div>
                              <div class="line">And from the bishop's huntsmen rescued him;</div>
                              <div class="line">For hunting was his daily exercise.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">My brother was too careless of his charge.</div>
                              <div class="line">But let us hence, my sovereign, to provide</div>
                              <div class="line">A salve for any sore that may betide.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but SOMERSET, HENRY OF RICHMOND, and OXFORD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, I like not of this flight of Edward's;</div>
                              <div class="line">For doubtless Burgundy will yield him help,</div>
                              <div class="line">And we shall have more wars before 't be long.</div>
                              <div class="line">As Henry's late presaging prophecy</div>
                              <div class="line">Did glad my heart with hope of this young Richmond,</div>
                              <div class="line">So doth my heart misgive me, in these conflicts</div>
                              <div class="line">What may befall him, to his harm and ours:</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, Lord Oxford, to prevent the worst,</div>
                              <div class="line">Forthwith we'll send him hence to Brittany,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till storms be past of civil enmity.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OXFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, for if Edward repossess the crown,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis like that Richmond with the rest shall down.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">It shall be so; he shall to Brittany.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, therefore, let's about it speedily.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.8">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>7. SCENE VII.  Before York.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Flourish. Enter KING EDWARD IV, GLOUCESTER,
HASTINGS, and Soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, brother Richard, Lord Hastings, and the rest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet thus far fortune maketh us amends,</div>
                              <div class="line">And says that once more I shall interchange</div>
                              <div class="line">My waned state for Henry's regal crown.</div>
                              <div class="line">Well have we pass'd and now repass'd the seas</div>
                              <div class="line">And brought desired help from Burgundy:</div>
                              <div class="line">What then remains, we being thus arrived</div>
                              <div class="line">From Ravenspurgh haven before the gates of York,</div>
                              <div class="line">But that we enter, as into our dukedom?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">The gates made fast! Brother, I like not this;</div>
                              <div class="line">For many men that stumble at the threshold</div>
                              <div class="line">Are well foretold that danger lurks within.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Tush, man, abodements must not now affright us:</div>
                              <div class="line">By fair or foul means we must enter in,</div>
                              <div class="line">For hither will our friends repair to us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">My liege, I'll knock once more to summon them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter, on the walls, the Mayor of York, and his Brethren</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Mayor</div>
                              <div class="line">My lords, we were forewarned of your coming,</div>
                              <div class="line">And shut the gates for safety of ourselves;</div>
                              <div class="line">For now we owe allegiance unto Henry.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">But, master mayor, if Henry be your king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet Edward at the least is Duke of York.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Mayor</div>
                              <div class="line">True, my good lord; I know you for no less.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, and I challenge nothing but my dukedom,</div>
                              <div class="line">As being well content with that alone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  But when the fox hath once got in his nose,</div>
                              <div class="line">He'll soon find means to make the body follow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, master mayor, why stand you in a doubt?</div>
                              <div class="line">Open the gates; we are King Henry's friends.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Mayor</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, say you so? the gates shall then be open'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>They descend</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">A wise stout captain, and soon persuaded!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">The good old man would fain that all were well,</div>
                              <div class="line">So 'twere not 'long of him; but being enter'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">I doubt not, I, but we shall soon persuade</div>
                              <div class="line">Both him and all his brothers unto reason.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the Mayor and two Aldermen, below</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">So, master mayor: these gates must not be shut</div>
                              <div class="line">But in the night or in the time of war.</div>
                              <div class="line">What! fear not, man, but yield me up the keys;</div>
                              <p>Takes his keys</p>
                              <div class="line">For Edward will defend the town and thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all those friends that deign to follow me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>March. Enter MONTGOMERY, with drum and soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Brother, this is Sir John Montgomery,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our trusty friend, unless I be deceived.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Welcome, Sir John! But why come you in arms?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">To help King Edward in his time of storm,</div>
                              <div class="line">As every loyal subject ought to do.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Thanks, good Montgomery; but we now forget</div>
                              <div class="line">Our title to the crown and only claim</div>
                              <div class="line">Our dukedom till God please to send the rest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">Then fare you well, for I will hence again:</div>
                              <div class="line">I came to serve a king and not a duke.</div>
                              <div class="line">Drummer, strike up, and let us march away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>The drum begins to march</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, stay, Sir John, awhile, and we'll debate</div>
                              <div class="line">By what safe means the crown may be recover'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">What talk you of debating? in few words,</div>
                              <div class="line">If you'll not here proclaim yourself our king,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll leave you to your fortune and be gone</div>
                              <div class="line">To keep them back that come to succor you:</div>
                              <div class="line">Why shall we fight, if you pretend no title?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, brother, wherefore stand you on nice points?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">When we grow stronger, then we'll make our claim:</div>
                              <div class="line">Till then, 'tis wisdom to conceal our meaning.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">Away with scrupulous wit! now arms must rule.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">And fearless minds climb soonest unto crowns.</div>
                              <div class="line">Brother, we will proclaim you out of hand:</div>
                              <div class="line">The bruit thereof will bring you many friends.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Then be it as you will; for 'tis my right,</div>
                              <div class="line">And Henry but usurps the diadem.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, now my sovereign speaketh like himself;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now will I be Edward's champion.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">Sound trumpet; Edward shall be here proclaim'd:</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, fellow-soldier, make thou proclamation.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Flourish</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Soldier</div>
                              <div class="line">Edward the Fourth, by the grace of God, king of</div>
                              <div class="line">England and France, and lord of Ireland, &c.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">And whosoe'er gainsays King Edward's right,</div>
                              <div class="line">By this I challenge him to single fight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Throws down his gauntlet</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">All</div>
                              <div class="line">Long live Edward the Fourth!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Thanks, brave Montgomery; and thanks unto you all:</div>
                              <div class="line">If fortune serve me, I'll requite this kindness.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, for this night, let's harbour here in York;</div>
                              <div class="line">And when the morning sun shall raise his car</div>
                              <div class="line">Above the border of this horizon,</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll forward towards Warwick and his mates;</div>
                              <div class="line">For well I wot that Henry is no soldier.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, froward Clarence! how evil it beseems thee</div>
                              <div class="line">To flatter Henry and forsake thy brother!</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, as we may, we'll meet both thee and Warwick.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come on, brave soldiers: doubt not of the day,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, that once gotten, doubt not of large pay.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.9">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>8. SCENE VIII.  London. The palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Flourish. Enter KING HENRY VI, WARWICK, MONTAGUE,
CLARENCE, EXETER, and OXFORD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">What counsel, lords? Edward from Belgia,</div>
                              <div class="line">With hasty Germans and blunt Hollanders,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath pass'd in safety through the narrow seas,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with his troops doth march amain to London;</div>
                              <div class="line">And many giddy people flock to him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's levy men, and beat him back again.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">A little fire is quickly trodden out;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, being suffer'd, rivers cannot quench.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">In Warwickshire I have true-hearted friends,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not mutinous in peace, yet bold in war;</div>
                              <div class="line">Those will I muster up: and thou, son Clarence,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shalt stir up in Suffolk, Norfolk, and in Kent,</div>
                              <div class="line">The knights and gentlemen to come with thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou, brother Montague, in Buckingham,</div>
                              <div class="line">Northampton and in Leicestershire, shalt find</div>
                              <div class="line">Men well inclined to hear what thou command'st:</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou, brave Oxford, wondrous well beloved,</div>
                              <div class="line">In Oxfordshire shalt muster up thy friends.</div>
                              <div class="line">My sovereign, with the loving citizens,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like to his island girt in with the ocean,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or modest Dian circled with her nymphs,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall rest in London till we come to him.</div>
                              <div class="line">Fair lords, take leave and stand not to reply.</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell, my sovereign.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell, my Hector, and my Troy's true hope.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">In sign of truth, I kiss your highness' hand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Well-minded Clarence, be thou fortunate!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">Comfort, my lord; and so I take my leave.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OXFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">And thus I seal my truth, and bid adieu.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet Oxford, and my loving Montague,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all at once, once more a happy farewell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell, sweet lords: let's meet at Coventry.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but KING HENRY VI and EXETER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Here at the palace I will rest awhile.</div>
                              <div class="line">Cousin of Exeter, what thinks your lordship?</div>
                              <div class="line">Methinks the power that Edward hath in field</div>
                              <div class="line">Should not be able to encounter mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                              <div class="line">The doubt is that he will seduce the rest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">That's not my fear; my meed hath got me fame:</div>
                              <div class="line">I have not stopp'd mine ears to their demands,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor posted off their suits with slow delays;</div>
                              <div class="line">My pity hath been balm to heal their wounds,</div>
                              <div class="line">My mildness hath allay'd their swelling griefs,</div>
                              <div class="line">My mercy dried their water-flowing tears;</div>
                              <div class="line">I have not been desirous of their wealth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor much oppress'd them with great subsidies.</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor forward of revenge, though they much err'd:</div>
                              <div class="line">Then why should they love Edward more than me?</div>
                              <div class="line">No, Exeter, these graces challenge grace:</div>
                              <div class="line">And when the lion fawns upon the lamb,</div>
                              <div class="line">The lamb will never cease to follow him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Shout within. 'A Lancaster! A Lancaster!'</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                              <div class="line">Hark, hark, my lord! what shouts are these?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter KING EDWARD IV, GLOUCESTER, and soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Seize on the shame-faced Henry, bear him hence;</div>
                              <div class="line">And once again proclaim us King of England.</div>
                              <div class="line">You are the fount that makes small brooks to flow:</div>
                              <div class="line">Now stops thy spring; my sea sha$l suck them dry,</div>
                              <div class="line">And swell so much the higher by their ebb.</div>
                              <div class="line">Hence with him to the Tower; let him not speak.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt some with KING HENRY VI</p>
                              <div class="line">And, lords, towards Coventry bend we our course</div>
                              <div class="line">Where peremptory Warwick now remains:</div>
                              <div class="line">The sun shines hot; and, if we use delay,</div>
                              <div class="line">Cold biting winter mars our hoped-for hay.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Away betimes, before his forces join,</div>
                              <div class="line">And take the great-grown traitor unawares:</div>
                              <div class="line">Brave warriors, march amain towards Coventry.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Coventry.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  Another part of the field.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  Plains near Tewksbury.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.6">5. SCENE V.  Another part of the field.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.7">6. SCENE VI.  London. The Tower.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.8">7. SCENE VII.  London. The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Coventry.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter WARWICK, the Mayor of Coventry, two Messengers,
and others upon the walls</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is the post that came from valiant Oxford?</div>
                              <div class="line">How far hence is thy lord, mine honest fellow?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">By this at Dunsmore, marching hitherward.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">How far off is our brother Montague?</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is the post that came from Montague?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">By this at Daintry, with a puissant troop.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter SIR JOHN SOMERVILLE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Say, Somerville, what says my loving son?</div>
                              <div class="line">And, by thy guess, how nigh is Clarence now?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">At Southam I did leave him with his forces,</div>
                              <div class="line">And do expect him here some two hours hence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Drum heard</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Then Clarence is at hand, I hear his drum.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">It is not his, my lord; here Southam lies:</div>
                              <div class="line">The drum your honour hears marcheth from Warwick.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Who should that be? belike, unlook'd-for friends.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">They are at hand, and you shall quickly know.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>March: flourish. Enter KING EDWARD IV, GLOUCESTER,
and soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, trumpet, to the walls, and sound a parle.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">See how the surly Warwick mans the wall!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">O unbid spite! is sportful Edward come?</div>
                              <div class="line">Where slept our scouts, or how are they seduced,</div>
                              <div class="line">That we could hear no news of his repair?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, Warwick, wilt thou ope the city gates,</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak gentle words and humbly bend thy knee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Call Edward king and at his hands beg mercy?</div>
                              <div class="line">And he shall pardon thee these outrages.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, rather, wilt thou draw thy forces hence,</div>
                              <div class="line">Confess who set thee up and pluck'd thee own,</div>
                              <div class="line">Call Warwick patron and be penitent?</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou shalt still remain the Duke of York.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I thought, at least, he would have said the king;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or did he make the jest against his will?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Is not a dukedom, sir, a goodly gift?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, by my faith, for a poor earl to give:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll do thee service for so good a gift.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twas I that gave the kingdom to thy brother.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Why then 'tis mine, if but by Warwick's gift.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art no Atlas for so great a weight:</div>
                              <div class="line">And weakling, Warwick takes his gift again;</div>
                              <div class="line">And Henry is my king, Warwick his subject.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">But Warwick's king is Edward's prisoner:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, gallant Warwick, do but answer this:</div>
                              <div class="line">What is the body when the head is off?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, that Warwick had no more forecast,</div>
                              <div class="line">But, whiles he thought to steal the single ten,</div>
                              <div class="line">The king was slily finger'd from the deck!</div>
                              <div class="line">You left poor Henry at the Bishop's palace,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, ten to one, you'll meet him in the Tower.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis even so; yet you are Warwick still.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, Warwick, take the time; kneel down, kneel down:</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, when? strike now, or else the iron cools.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">I had rather chop this hand off at a blow,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with the other fling it at thy face,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than bear so low a sail, to strike to thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Sail how thou canst, have wind and tide thy friend,</div>
                              <div class="line">This hand, fast wound about thy coal-black hair</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall, whiles thy head is warm and new cut off,</div>
                              <div class="line">Write in the dust this sentence with thy blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Wind-changing Warwick now can change no more.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter OXFORD, with drum and colours</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">O cheerful colours! see where Oxford comes!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OXFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Oxford, Oxford, for Lancaster!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>He and his forces enter the city</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
