                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">The gates are open, let us enter too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">So other foes may set upon our backs.</div>
                              <div class="line">Stand we in good array; for they no doubt</div>
                              <div class="line">Will issue out again and bid us battle:</div>
                              <div class="line">If not, the city being but of small defence,</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll quickly rouse the traitors in the same.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">O, welcome, Oxford! for we want thy help.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter MONTAGUE with drum and colours</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">Montague, Montague, for Lancaster!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>He and his forces enter the city</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou and thy brother both shall buy this treason</div>
                              <div class="line">Even with the dearest blood your bodies bear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">The harder match'd, the greater victory:</div>
                              <div class="line">My mind presageth happy gain and conquest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter SOMERSET, with drum and colours</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">Somerset, Somerset, for Lancaster!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>He and his forces enter the city</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Two of thy name, both Dukes of Somerset,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have sold their lives unto the house of York;</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou shalt be the third if this sword hold.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter CLARENCE, with drum and colours</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">And lo, where George of Clarence sweeps along,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of force enough to bid his brother battle;</div>
                              <div class="line">With whom an upright zeal to right prevails</div>
                              <div class="line">More than the nature of a brother's love!</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, Clarence, come; thou wilt, if Warwick call.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Father of Warwick, know you what this means?</div>
                              <p>Taking his red rose out of his hat</p>
                              <div class="line">Look here, I throw my infamy at thee</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not ruinate my father's house,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who gave his blood to lime the stones together,</div>
                              <div class="line">And set up Lancaster. Why, trow'st thou, Warwick,</div>
                              <div class="line">That Clarence is so harsh, so blunt, unnatural,</div>
                              <div class="line">To bend the fatal instruments of war</div>
                              <div class="line">Against his brother and his lawful king?</div>
                              <div class="line">Perhaps thou wilt object my holy oath:</div>
                              <div class="line">To keep that oath were more impiety</div>
                              <div class="line">Than Jephthah's, when he sacrificed his daughter.</div>
                              <div class="line">I am so sorry for my trespass made</div>
                              <div class="line">That, to deserve well at my brother's hands,</div>
                              <div class="line">I here proclaim myself thy mortal foe,</div>
                              <div class="line">With resolution, wheresoe'er I meet thee--</div>
                              <div class="line">As I will meet thee, if thou stir abroad--</div>
                              <div class="line">To plague thee for thy foul misleading me.</div>
                              <div class="line">And so, proud-hearted Warwick, I defy thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">And to my brother turn my blushing cheeks.</div>
                              <div class="line">Pardon me, Edward, I will make amends:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, Richard, do not frown upon my faults,</div>
                              <div class="line">For I will henceforth be no more unconstant.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Now welcome more, and ten times more beloved,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than if thou never hadst deserved our hate.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Welcome, good Clarence; this is brotherlike.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">O passing traitor, perjured and unjust!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">What, Warwick, wilt thou leave the town and fight?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or shall we beat the stones about thine ears?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, I am not coop'd here for defence!</div>
                              <div class="line">I will away towards Barnet presently,</div>
                              <div class="line">And bid thee battle, Edward, if thou darest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, Warwick, Edward dares, and leads the way.</div>
                              <div class="line">Lords, to the field; Saint George and victory!</div>
                              <p>Exeunt King Edward and his company. March. Warwick
and his company follow</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Alarum and excursions. Enter KING EDWARD IV, bringing
forth WARWICK wounded</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">So, lie thou there: die thou, and die our fear;</div>
                              <div class="line">For Warwick was a bug that fear'd us all.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, Montague, sit fast; I seek for thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">That Warwick's bones may keep thine company.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, who is nigh? come to me, friend or foe,</div>
                              <div class="line">And tell me who is victor, York or Warwick?</div>
                              <div class="line">Why ask I that? my mangled body shows,</div>
                              <div class="line">My blood, my want of strength, my sick heart shows.</div>
                              <div class="line">That I must yield my body to the earth</div>
                              <div class="line">And, by my fall, the conquest to my foe.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus yields the cedar to the axe's edge,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose arms gave shelter to the princely eagle,</div>
                              <div class="line">Under whose shade the ramping lion slept,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose top-branch overpeer'd Jove's spreading tree</div>
                              <div class="line">And kept low shrubs from winter's powerful wind.</div>
                              <div class="line">These eyes, that now are dimm'd with death's black veil,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have been as piercing as the mid-day sun,</div>
                              <div class="line">To search the secret treasons of the world:</div>
                              <div class="line">The wrinkles in my brows, now filled with blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Were liken'd oft to kingly sepulchres;</div>
                              <div class="line">For who lived king, but I could dig his grave?</div>
                              <div class="line">And who durst mine when Warwick bent his brow?</div>
                              <div class="line">Lo, now my glory smear'd in dust and blood!</div>
                              <div class="line">My parks, my walks, my manors that I had.</div>
                              <div class="line">Even now forsake me, and of all my lands</div>
                              <div class="line">Is nothing left me but my body's length.</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, what is pomp, rule, reign, but earth and dust?</div>
                              <div class="line">And, live we how we can, yet die we must.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter OXFORD and SOMERSET</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, Warwick, Warwick! wert thou as we are.</div>
                              <div class="line">We might recover all our loss again;</div>
                              <div class="line">The queen from France hath brought a puissant power:</div>
                              <div class="line">Even now we heard the news: ah, could'st thou fly!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then I would not fly. Ah, Montague,</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou be there, sweet brother, take my hand.</div>
                              <div class="line">And with thy lips keep in my soul awhile!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou lovest me not; for, brother, if thou didst,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy tears would wash this cold congealed blood</div>
                              <div class="line">That glues my lips and will not let me speak.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come quickly, Montague, or I am dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, Warwick! Montague hath breathed his last;</div>
                              <div class="line">And to the latest gasp cried out for Warwick,</div>
                              <div class="line">And said 'Commend me to my valiant brother.'</div>
                              <div class="line">And more he would have said, and more he spoke,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which sounded like a clamour in a vault,</div>
                              <div class="line">That mought not be distinguished; but at last</div>
                              <div class="line">I well might hear, delivered with a groan,</div>
                              <div class="line">'O, farewell, Warwick!'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet rest his soul! Fly, lords, and save yourselves;</div>
                              <div class="line">For Warwick bids you all farewell to meet in heaven.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Dies</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OXFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Away, away, to meet the queen's great power!</div>
                              <p>Here they bear away his body. Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  Another part of the field.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Flourish. Enter KING EDWARD IV in triumph; with
GLOUCESTER, CLARENCE, and the rest</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus far our fortune keeps an upward course,</div>
                              <div class="line">And we are graced with wreaths of victory.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, in the midst of this bright-shining day,</div>
                              <div class="line">I spy a black, suspicious, threatening cloud,</div>
                              <div class="line">That will encounter with our glorious sun,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ere he attain his easeful western bed:</div>
                              <div class="line">I mean, my lords, those powers that the queen</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath raised in Gallia have arrived our coast</div>
                              <div class="line">And, as we hear, march on to fight with us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">A little gale will soon disperse that cloud</div>
                              <div class="line">And blow it to the source from whence it came:</div>
                              <div class="line">The very beams will dry those vapours up,</div>
                              <div class="line">For every cloud engenders not a storm.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">The queen is valued thirty thousand strong,</div>
                              <div class="line">And Somerset, with Oxford fled to her:</div>
                              <div class="line">If she have time to breathe be well assured</div>
                              <div class="line">Her faction will be full as strong as ours.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">We are advertised by our loving friends</div>
                              <div class="line">That they do hold their course toward Tewksbury:</div>
                              <div class="line">We, having now the best at Barnet field,</div>
                              <div class="line">Will thither straight, for willingness rids way;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, as we march, our strength will be augmented</div>
                              <div class="line">In every county as we go along.</div>
                              <div class="line">Strike up the drum; cry 'Courage!' and away.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Plains near Tewksbury.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>March. Enter QUEEN MARGARET, PRINCE EDWARD,
SOMERSET, OXFORD, and soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Great lords, wise men ne'er sit and wail their loss,</div>
                              <div class="line">But cheerly seek how to redress their harms.</div>
                              <div class="line">What though the mast be now blown overboard,</div>
                              <div class="line">The cable broke, the holding-anchor lost,</div>
                              <div class="line">And half our sailors swallow'd in the flood?</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet lives our pilot still. Is't meet that he</div>
                              <div class="line">Should leave the helm and like a fearful lad</div>
                              <div class="line">With tearful eyes add water to the sea</div>
                              <div class="line">And give more strength to that which hath too much,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whiles, in his moan, the ship splits on the rock,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which industry and courage might have saved?</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, what a shame! ah, what a fault were this!</div>
                              <div class="line">Say Warwick was our anchor; what of that?</div>
                              <div class="line">And Montague our topmost; what of him?</div>
                              <div class="line">Our slaughter'd friends the tackles; what of these?</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, is not Oxford here another anchor?</div>
                              <div class="line">And Somerset another goodly mast?</div>
                              <div class="line">The friends of France our shrouds and tacklings?</div>
                              <div class="line">And, though unskilful, why not Ned and I</div>
                              <div class="line">For once allow'd the skilful pilot's charge?</div>
                              <div class="line">We will not from the helm to sit and weep,</div>
                              <div class="line">But keep our course, though the rough wind say no,</div>
                              <div class="line">From shelves and rocks that threaten us with wreck.</div>
                              <div class="line">As good to chide the waves as speak them fair.</div>
                              <div class="line">And what is Edward but ruthless sea?</div>
                              <div class="line">What Clarence but a quicksand of deceit?</div>
                              <div class="line">And Richard but a ragged fatal rock?</div>
                              <div class="line">All these the enemies to our poor bark.</div>
                              <div class="line">Say you can swim; alas, 'tis but a while!</div>
                              <div class="line">Tread on the sand; why, there you quickly sink:</div>
                              <div class="line">Bestride the rock; the tide will wash you off,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or else you famish; that's a threefold death.</div>
                              <div class="line">This speak I, lords, to let you understand,</div>
                              <div class="line">If case some one of you would fly from us,</div>
                              <div class="line">That there's no hoped-for mercy with the brothers</div>
                              <div class="line">More than with ruthless waves, with sands and rocks.</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, courage then! what cannot be avoided</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twere childish weakness to lament or fear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Methinks a woman of this valiant spirit</div>
                              <div class="line">Should, if a coward heard her speak these words,</div>
                              <div class="line">Infuse his breast with magnanimity</div>
                              <div class="line">And make him, naked, foil a man at arms.</div>
                              <div class="line">I speak not this as doubting any here</div>
                              <div class="line">For did I but suspect a fearful man</div>
                              <div class="line">He should have leave to go away betimes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest in our need he might infect another</div>
                              <div class="line">And make him of like spirit to himself.</div>
                              <div class="line">If any such be here--as God forbid!--</div>
                              <div class="line">Let him depart before we need his help.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OXFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Women and children of so high a courage,</div>
                              <div class="line">And warriors faint! why, 'twere perpetual shame.</div>
                              <div class="line">O brave young prince! thy famous grandfather</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth live again in thee: long mayst thou live</div>
                              <div class="line">To bear his image and renew his glories!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">And he that will not fight for such a hope.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go home to bed, and like the owl by day,</div>
                              <div class="line">If he arise, be mock'd and wonder'd at.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Thanks, gentle Somerset; sweet Oxford, thanks.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">And take his thanks that yet hath nothing else.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">Prepare you, lords, for Edward is at hand.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ready to fight; therefore be resolute.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OXFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">I thought no less: it is his policy</div>
                              <div class="line">To haste thus fast, to find us unprovided.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">But he's deceived; we are in readiness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">This cheers my heart, to see your forwardness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OXFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Here pitch our battle; hence we will not budge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Flourish and march. Enter KING EDWARD IV, GLOUCESTER,
CLARENCE, and soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Brave followers, yonder stands the thorny wood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, by the heavens' assistance and your strength,</div>
                              <div class="line">Must by the roots be hewn up yet ere night.</div>
                              <div class="line">I need not add more fuel to your fire,</div>
                              <div class="line">For well I wot ye blaze to burn them out</div>
                              <div class="line">Give signal to the fight, and to it, lords!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Lords, knights, and gentlemen, what I should say</div>
                              <div class="line">My tears gainsay; for every word I speak,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ye see, I drink the water of mine eyes.</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, no more but this: Henry, your sovereign,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is prisoner to the foe; his state usurp'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">His realm a slaughter-house, his subjects slain,</div>
                              <div class="line">His statutes cancell'd and his treasure spent;</div>
                              <div class="line">And yonder is the wolf that makes this spoil.</div>
                              <div class="line">You fight in justice: then, in God's name, lords,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be valiant and give signal to the fight.</div>
                              <p>Alarum. Retreat. Excursions. Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE V.  Another part of the field.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Flourish. Enter KING EDWARD IV, GLOUCESTER, CLARENCE,
and soldiers; with QUEEN MARGARET, OXFORD, and
SOMERSET, prisoners</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Now here a period of tumultuous broils.</div>
                              <div class="line">Away with Oxford to Hames Castle straight:</div>
                              <div class="line">For Somerset, off with his guilty head.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, bear them hence; I will not hear them speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OXFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">For my part, I'll not trouble thee with words.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor I, but stoop with patience to my fortune.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt Oxford and Somerset, guarded</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">So part we sadly in this troublous world,</div>
                              <div class="line">To meet with joy in sweet Jerusalem.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Is proclamation made, that who finds Edward</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall have a high reward, and he his life?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">It is: and lo, where youthful Edward comes!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter soldiers, with PRINCE EDWARD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Bring forth the gallant, let us hear him speak.</div>
                              <div class="line">What! can so young a thorn begin to prick?</div>
                              <div class="line">Edward, what satisfaction canst thou make</div>
                              <div class="line">For bearing arms, for stirring up my subjects,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all the trouble thou hast turn'd me to?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak like a subject, proud ambitious York!</div>
                              <div class="line">Suppose that I am now my father's mouth;</div>
                              <div class="line">Resign thy chair, and where I stand kneel thou,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whilst I propose the selfsame words to thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which traitor, thou wouldst have me answer to.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, that thy father had been so resolved!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">That you might still have worn the petticoat,</div>
                              <div class="line">And ne'er have stol'n the breech from Lancaster.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Let AEsop fable in a winter's night;</div>
                              <div class="line">His currish riddles sort not with this place.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">By heaven, brat, I'll plague ye for that word.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, thou wast born to be a plague to men.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">For God's sake, take away this captive scold.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, take away this scolding crookback rather.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, wilful boy, or I will charm your tongue.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Untutor'd lad, thou art too malapert.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                              <div class="line">I know my duty; you are all undutiful:</div>
                              <div class="line">Lascivious Edward, and thou perjured George,</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou mis-shapen Dick, I tell ye all</div>
                              <div class="line">I am your better, traitors as ye are:</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou usurp'st my father's right and mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Take that, thou likeness of this railer here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Stabs him</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Sprawl'st thou? take that, to end thy agony.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Stabs him</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">And there's for twitting me with perjury.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Stabs him</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">O, kill me too!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, and shall.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Offers to kill her</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Hold, Richard, hold; for we have done too much.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Why should she live, to fill the world with words?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">What, doth she swoon? use means for her recovery.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Clarence, excuse me to the king my brother;</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll hence to London on a serious matter:</div>
                              <div class="line">Ere ye come there, be sure to hear some news.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">What? what?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">The Tower, the Tower.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">O Ned, sweet Ned! speak to thy mother, boy!</div>
                              <div class="line">Canst thou not speak? O traitors! murderers!</div>
                              <div class="line">They that stabb'd Caesar shed no blood at all,</div>
                              <div class="line">Did not offend, nor were not worthy blame,</div>
                              <div class="line">If this foul deed were by to equal it:</div>
                              <div class="line">He was a man; this, in respect, a child:</div>
                              <div class="line">And men ne'er spend their fury on a child.</div>
                              <div class="line">What's worse than murderer, that I may name it?</div>
                              <div class="line">No, no, my heart will burst, and if I speak:</div>
                              <div class="line">And I will speak, that so my heart may burst.</div>
                              <div class="line">Butchers and villains! bloody cannibals!</div>
                              <div class="line">How sweet a plant have you untimely cropp'd!</div>
                              <div class="line">You have no children, butchers! if you had,</div>
                              <div class="line">The thought of them would have stirr'd up remorse:</div>
                              <div class="line">But if you ever chance to have a child,</div>
                              <div class="line">Look in his youth to have him so cut off</div>
                              <div class="line">As, deathmen, you have rid this sweet young prince!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Away with her; go, bear her hence perforce.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, never bear me hence, dispatch me here,</div>
                              <div class="line">Here sheathe thy sword, I'll pardon thee my death:</div>
                              <div class="line">What, wilt thou not? then, Clarence, do it thou.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">By heaven, I will not do thee so much ease.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Good Clarence, do; sweet Clarence, do thou do it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Didst thou not hear me swear I would not do it?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, but thou usest to forswear thyself:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twas sin before, but now 'tis charity.</div>
                              <div class="line">What, wilt thou not? Where is that devil's butcher,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hard-favour'd Richard? Richard, where art thou?</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art not here: murder is thy alms-deed;</div>
                              <div class="line">Petitioners for blood thou ne'er put'st back.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Away, I say; I charge ye, bear her hence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">So come to you and yours, as to this Prince!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit, led out forcibly</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Where's Richard gone?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">To London, all in post; and, as I guess,</div>
                              <div class="line">To make a bloody supper in the Tower.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">He's sudden, if a thing comes in his head.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now march we hence: discharge the common sort</div>
                              <div class="line">With pay and thanks, and let's away to London</div>
                              <div class="line">And see our gentle queen how well she fares:</div>
                              <div class="line">By this, I hope, she hath a son for me.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.7">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>6. SCENE VI.  London. The Tower.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter KING HENRY VI and GLOUCESTER, with the
Lieutenant, on the walls</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Good day, my lord. What, at your book so hard?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, my good lord:--my lord, I should say rather;</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis sin to flatter; 'good' was little better:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Good Gloucester' and 'good devil' were alike,</div>
                              <div class="line">And both preposterous; therefore, not 'good lord.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Sirrah, leave us to ourselves: we must confer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit Lieutenant</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">So flies the reckless shepherd from the wolf;</div>
                              <div class="line">So first the harmless sheep doth yield his fleece</div>
                              <div class="line">And next his throat unto the butcher's knife.</div>
                              <div class="line">What scene of death hath Roscius now to act?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Suspicion always haunts the guilty mind;</div>
                              <div class="line">The thief doth fear each bush an officer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">The bird that hath been limed in a bush,</div>
                              <div class="line">With trembling wings misdoubteth every bush;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I, the hapless male to one sweet bird,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have now the fatal object in my eye</div>
                              <div class="line">Where my poor young was limed, was caught and kill'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, what a peevish fool was that of Crete,</div>
                              <div class="line">That taught his son the office of a fowl!</div>
                              <div class="line">An yet, for all his wings, the fool was drown'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">I, Daedalus; my poor boy, Icarus;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy father, Minos, that denied our course;</div>
                              <div class="line">The sun that sear'd the wings of my sweet boy</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy brother Edward, and thyself the sea</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose envious gulf did swallow up his life.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, kill me with thy weapon, not with words!</div>
                              <div class="line">My breast can better brook thy dagger's point</div>
                              <div class="line">Than can my ears that tragic history.</div>
                              <div class="line">But wherefore dost thou come? is't for my life?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Think'st thou I am an executioner?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">A persecutor, I am sure, thou art:</div>
                              <div class="line">If murdering innocents be executing,</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then thou art an executioner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy son I kill'd for his presumption.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Hadst thou been kill'd when first thou didst presume,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hadst not lived to kill a son of mine.</div>
                              <div class="line">And thus I prophesy, that many a thousand,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which now mistrust no parcel of my fear,</div>
                              <div class="line">And many an old man's sigh and many a widow's,</div>
                              <div class="line">And many an orphan's water-standing eye--</div>
                              <div class="line">Men for their sons, wives for their husbands,</div>
                              <div class="line">And orphans for their parents timeless death--</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall rue the hour that ever thou wast born.</div>
                              <div class="line">The owl shriek'd at thy birth,--an evil sign;</div>
                              <div class="line">The night-crow cried, aboding luckless time;</div>
                              <div class="line">Dogs howl'd, and hideous tempest shook down trees;</div>
                              <div class="line">The raven rook'd her on the chimney's top,</div>
                              <div class="line">And chattering pies in dismal discords sung.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy mother felt more than a mother's pain,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, yet brought forth less than a mother's hope,</div>
                              <div class="line">To wit, an indigested and deformed lump,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not like the fruit of such a goodly tree.</div>
                              <div class="line">Teeth hadst thou in thy head when thou wast born,</div>
                              <div class="line">To signify thou camest to bite the world:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, if the rest be true which I have heard,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou camest--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll hear no more: die, prophet in thy speech:</div>
                              <p>Stabs him</p>
                              <div class="line">For this amongst the rest, was I ordain'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, and for much more slaughter after this.</div>
                              <div class="line">God forgive my sins, and pardon thee!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Dies</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">What, will the aspiring blood of Lancaster</div>
                              <div class="line">Sink in the ground? I thought it would have mounted.</div>
                              <div class="line">See how my sword weeps for the poor king's death!</div>
                              <div class="line">O, may such purple tears be alway shed</div>
                              <div class="line">From those that wish the downfall of our house!</div>
                              <div class="line">If any spark of life be yet remaining,</div>
                              <div class="line">Down, down to hell; and say I sent thee thither:</div>
                              <p>Stabs him again</p>
                              <div class="line">I, that have neither pity, love, nor fear.</div>
                              <div class="line">Indeed, 'tis true that Henry told me of;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I have often heard my mother say</div>
                              <div class="line">I came into the world with my legs forward:</div>
                              <div class="line">Had I not reason, think ye, to make haste,</div>
                              <div class="line">And seek their ruin that usurp'd our right?</div>
                              <div class="line">The midwife wonder'd and the women cried</div>
                              <div class="line">'O, Jesus bless us, he is born with teeth!'</div>
                              <div class="line">And so I was; which plainly signified</div>
                              <div class="line">That I should snarl and bite and play the dog.</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, since the heavens have shaped my body so,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let hell make crook'd my mind to answer it.</div>
                              <div class="line">I have no brother, I am like no brother;</div>
                              <div class="line">And this word 'love,' which graybeards call divine,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be resident in men like one another</div>
                              <div class="line">And not in me: I am myself alone.</div>
                              <div class="line">Clarence, beware; thou keep'st me from the light:</div>
                              <div class="line">But I will sort a pitchy day for thee;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I will buz abroad such prophecies</div>
                              <div class="line">That Edward shall be fearful of his life,</div>
                              <div class="line">And then, to purge his fear, I'll be thy death.</div>
                              <div class="line">King Henry and the prince his son are gone:</div>
                              <div class="line">Clarence, thy turn is next, and then the rest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Counting myself but bad till I be best.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll throw thy body in another room</div>
                              <div class="line">And triumph, Henry, in thy day of doom.</div>
                              <p>Exit, with the body</p>
                              <div class="line">3 KING HENRY VI</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.8">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>7. SCENE VII.  London. The palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Flourish. Enter KING EDWARD IV, QUEEN ELIZABETH,
CLARENCE, GLOUCESTER, HASTINGS, a Nurse with the
young Prince, and Attendants</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Once more we sit in England's royal throne,</div>
                              <div class="line">Re-purchased with the blood of enemies.</div>
                              <div class="line">What valiant foemen, like to autumn's corn,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have we mow'd down, in tops of all their pride!</div>
                              <div class="line">Three Dukes of Somerset, threefold renown'd</div>
                              <div class="line">For hardy and undoubted champions;</div>
                              <div class="line">Two Cliffords, as the father and the son,</div>
                              <div class="line">And two Northumberlands; two braver men</div>
                              <div class="line">Ne'er spurr'd their coursers at the trumpet's sound;</div>
                              <div class="line">With them, the two brave bears, Warwick and Montague,</div>
                              <div class="line">That in their chains fetter'd the kingly lion</div>
                              <div class="line">And made the forest tremble when they roar'd.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus have we swept suspicion from our seat</div>
                              <div class="line">And made our footstool of security.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come hither, Bess, and let me kiss my boy.</div>
                              <div class="line">Young Ned, for thee, thine uncles and myself</div>
                              <div class="line">Have in our armours watch'd the winter's night,</div>
                              <div class="line">Went all afoot in summer's scalding heat,</div>
                              <div class="line">That thou mightst repossess the crown in peace;</div>
                              <div class="line">And of our labours thou shalt reap the gain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  I'll blast his harvest, if your head were laid;</div>
                              <div class="line">For yet I am not look'd on in the world.</div>
                              <div class="line">This shoulder was ordain'd so thick to heave;</div>
                              <div class="line">And heave it shall some weight, or break my back:</div>
                              <div class="line">Work thou the way,--and thou shalt execute.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Clarence and Gloucester, love my lovely queen;</div>
                              <div class="line">And kiss your princely nephew, brothers both.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">The duty that I owe unto your majesty</div>
                              <div class="line">I seal upon the lips of this sweet babe.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">Thanks, noble Clarence; worthy brother, thanks.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">And, that I love the tree from whence thou sprang'st,</div>
                              <div class="line">Witness the loving kiss I give the fruit.</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  To say the truth, so Judas kiss'd his master,</div>
                              <div class="line">And cried 'all hail!' when as he meant all harm.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Now am I seated as my soul delights,</div>
                              <div class="line">Having my country's peace and brothers' loves.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">What will your grace have done with Margaret?</div>
                              <div class="line">Reignier, her father, to the king of France</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath pawn'd the Sicils and Jerusalem,</div>
                              <div class="line">And hither have they sent it for her ransom.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Away with her, and waft her hence to France.</div>
                              <div class="line">And now what rests but that we spend the time</div>
                              <div class="line">With stately triumphs, mirthful comic shows,</div>
                              <div class="line">Such as befits the pleasure of the court?</div>
                              <div class="line">Sound drums and trumpets! farewell sour annoy!</div>
                              <div class="line">For here, I hope, begins our lasting joy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
         </div>
      </article>

The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

    • 3. SCENE III. A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

    • 5. SCENE V. Another part of the field.
    • 6. SCENE VI. Another part of the field.

    • 1. SCENE I. A forest in the north of England.
    • 2. SCENE II. London. The palace.
    • 3. SCENE III. France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

    • 4. SCENE IV. London. The palace.
    • 5. SCENE V. A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

    • 2. SCENE II. A field of battle near Barnet.

Dramatis Personae

KING HENRY, the Sixth.

EDWARD, PRINCE OF WALES, his son.

KING LEWIS XI, King of France.

DUKE OF SOMERSET

DUKE OF EXETER

EARL OF OXFORD

EARL OF NORTHUMBERLAND

EARL OF WESTMORELAND

LORD CLIFFORD

RICHARD PLANTAGENET, Duke of York.

EDWARD, Earl of March, afterwards King Edward IV. EDMUND, Earl of Rutland. GEORGE, afterwards Duke of Clarence. RICHARD afterwards Duke of Gloucester. his sons.

DUKE OF NORFOLK

MARQUESS OF MONTAGUE

EARL OF WARWICK

EARL OF PEMBROKE

LORD HASTINGS

LORD STAFFORD

SIR JOHN MORTIMER SIR HUGH MORTIMER uncles to the Duke of York.

HENRY, Earl of Richmond, a youth.

LORD RIVERS, brother to Lady Grey.

SIR WILLIAM STANLEY

SIR JOHN MONTGOMERY

SIR JOHN SOMERVILLE

Tutor to Rutland.

Mayor of York.

Lieutenant of the Tower.

A Nobleman.

Two Keepers.

A Huntsman.

A Son that has killed his father.

A Father that has killed his son.

QUEEN MARGARET

LADY GREY, afterwards Queen to Edward IV.

BONA, sister to the French Queen.

Soldiers, Attendants, Messengers, Watchmen, &c.

SCENE England and France.

Chapter 1. ACT I

Table of Contents

  • 1. SCENE I. London. The Parliament-house.
  • 2. SCENE II. Sandal Castle.
  • 3. SCENE III. Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
  • 4. SCENE IV. Another part of the field.

1. SCENE I. London. The Parliament-house.

Alarum. Enter YORK, EDWARD, RICHARD, NORFOLK, MONTAGUE, WARWICK, and Soldiers

WARWICK
I wonder how the king escaped our hands.
YORK
While we pursued the horsemen of the north,
He slily stole away and left his men:
Whereat the great Lord of Northumberland,
Whose warlike ears could never brook retreat,
Cheer'd up the drooping army; and himself,
Lord Clifford and Lord Stafford, all abreast,
Charged our main battle's front, and breaking in
Were by the swords of common soldiers slain.
EDWARD
Lord Stafford's father, Duke of Buckingham,
Is either slain or wounded dangerously;
I cleft his beaver with a downright blow:
That this is true, father, behold his blood.
MONTAGUE
And, brother, here's the Earl of Wiltshire's blood,
Whom I encounter'd as the battles join'd.
RICHARD
Speak thou for me and tell them what I did.

Throwing down SOMERSET's head

YORK
Richard hath best deserved of all my sons.
But is your grace dead, my Lord of Somerset?
NORFOLK
Such hope have all the line of John of Gaunt!
RICHARD
Thus do I hope to shake King Henry's head.
WARWICK
And so do I. Victorious Prince of York,
Before I see thee seated in that throne
Which now the house of Lancaster usurps,
I vow by heaven these eyes shall never close.
This is the palace of the fearful king,
And this the regal seat: possess it, York;
For this is thine and not King Henry's heirs'
YORK
Assist me, then, sweet Warwick, and I will;
For hither we have broken in by force.
NORFOLK
We'll all assist you; he that flies shall die.
YORK
Thanks, gentle Norfolk: stay by me, my lords;
And, soldiers, stay and lodge by me this night.

They go up

WARWICK
And when the king comes, offer no violence,
Unless he seek to thrust you out perforce.
YORK
The queen this day here holds her parliament,
But little thinks we shall be of her council:
By words or blows here let us win our right.
RICHARD
Arm'd as we are, let's stay within this house.
WARWICK
The bloody parliament shall this be call'd,
Unless Plantagenet, Duke of York, be king,
And bashful Henry deposed, whose cowardice
Hath made us by-words to our enemies.
YORK
Then leave me not, my lords; be resolute;
I mean to take possession of my right.
WARWICK
Neither the king, nor he that loves him best,
The proudest he that holds up Lancaster,
Dares stir a wing, if Warwick shake his bells.
I'll plant Plantagenet, root him up who dares:
Resolve thee, Richard; claim the English crown.

Flourish. Enter KING HENRY VI, CLIFFORD, NORTHUMBERLAND, WESTMORELAND, EXETER, and the rest

KING HENRY VI
My lords, look where the sturdy rebel sits,
Even in the chair of state: belike he means,
Back'd by the power of Warwick, that false peer,
To aspire unto the crown and reign as king.
Earl of Northumberland, he slew thy father.
And thine, Lord Clifford; and you both have vow'd revenge
On him, his sons, his favourites and his friends.
NORTHUMBERLAND
If I be not, heavens be revenged on me!
CLIFFORD
The hope thereof makes Clifford mourn in steel.
WESTMORELAND
What, shall we suffer this? let's pluck him down:
My heart for anger burns; I cannot brook it.
KING HENRY VI
Be patient, gentle Earl of Westmoreland.
CLIFFORD
Patience is for poltroons, such as he:
He durst not sit there, had your father lived.
My gracious lord, here in the parliament
Let us assail the family of York.
NORTHUMBERLAND
Well hast thou spoken, cousin: be it so.
KING HENRY VI
Ah, know you not the city favours them,
And they have troops of soldiers at their beck?
EXETER
But when the duke is slain, they'll quickly fly.
KING HENRY VI
Far be the thought of this from Henry's heart,
To make a shambles of the parliament-house!
Cousin of Exeter, frowns, words and threats
Shall be the war that Henry means to use.
Thou factious Duke of York, descend my throne,
and kneel for grace and mercy at my feet;
I am thy sovereign.
YORK
I am thine.
EXETER
For shame, come down: he made thee Duke of York.
YORK
'Twas my inheritance, as the earldom was.
EXETER
Thy father was a traitor to the crown.
WARWICK
Exeter, thou art a traitor to the crown
In following this usurping Henry.
CLIFFORD
Whom should he follow but his natural king?
WARWICK
True, Clifford; and that's Richard Duke of York.
KING HENRY VI
And shall I stand, and thou sit in my throne?
YORK
It must and shall be so: content thyself.
WARWICK
Be Duke of Lancaster; let him be king.
WESTMORELAND
He is both king and Duke of Lancaster;
And that the Lord of Westmoreland shall maintain.
WARWICK
And Warwick shall disprove it. You forget
That we are those which chased you from the field
And slew your fathers, and with colours spread
March'd through the city to the palace gates.
NORTHUMBERLAND
Yes, Warwick, I remember it to my grief;
And, by his soul, thou and thy house shall rue it.
WESTMORELAND
Plantagenet, of thee and these thy sons,
Thy kinsman and thy friends, I'll have more lives
Than drops of blood were in my father's veins.
CLIFFORD
Urge it no more; lest that, instead of words,
I send thee, Warwick, such a messenger
As shall revenge his death before I stir.
WARWICK
Poor Clifford! how I scorn his worthless threats!
YORK
Will you we show our title to the crown?
If not, our swords shall plead it in the field.
KING HENRY VI
What title hast thou, traitor, to the crown?
Thy father was, as thou art, Duke of York;
Thy grandfather, Roger Mortimer, Earl of March:
I am the son of Henry the Fifth,
Who made the Dauphin and the French to stoop
And seized upon their towns and provinces.
WARWICK
Talk not of France, sith thou hast lost it all.
KING HENRY VI
The lord protector lost it, and not I:
When I was crown'd I was but nine months old.
RICHARD
You are old enough now, and yet, methinks, you lose.
Father, tear the crown from the usurper's head.
EDWARD
Sweet father, do so; set it on your head.
MONTAGUE
Good brother, as thou lovest and honourest arms,
Let's fight it out and not stand cavilling thus.
RICHARD
Sound drums and trumpets, and the king will fly.
YORK
Sons, peace!
KING HENRY VI
Peace, thou! and give King Henry leave to speak.
WARWICK
